0.title: Curriculum Alignment And Standards For All Students
0.description: Provides for the review of existing and the development of new statewide academic standards by the commissioner of education.

1.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1.title: Compulsory Attendance
1.description: Directs school districts experiencing high rates of student absenteeism to establish attendance review teams to address this absenteeism.

2.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2.title: Relating To Taxation
2.description: Defines as "disabled," persons receiving veterans' affairs disability benefits paid by the federal government for purposes of property tax relief and would be retroactive to January 1, 2018.

3.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
3.title: State Aid--town Of Exeter
3.description: Clarifies the status of pilot payments to the town of Exeter in view of its not presently having a police department.

4.title: Miscellaneous Rules--motor Vehicle Offenses
4.description: Amends towing storage act and clarifies towing and storage issues.

5.title: Relating To Solemnization Of Marriages
5.description: Allows Andrew Gavin to join Alison Gavin and Joey Ho in marriage on or about May 4, 2019, within the City of Newport, Rhode Island.

7.title: Voting Districts And Officials
7.description: Allows the board of canvassers of the town of Bristol to combine two (2) or more voting districts for the representative district 68 special election in March, 2019.

8.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
8.title: Weapons
8.description: Criminalizes possession of a firearm by a minor, except when the minor is engaged in certain activities and when accompanied by a parent, guardian, or qualified adult.

10.title: Domestic Abuse Prevention
10.description: Expands family court jurisdiction to enter protective orders to provide for the safety and welfare of household pets in domestic abuse situations.

11.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
11.title: Joint Committee Of The Repealer
11.description: Creates the joint committee of the repealer to compile suggestions for repeal of statutes, regulations, and executive orders received from citizens, businesses, and government agencies.

12.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
12.title: Access To Public Records
12.description: Provides copies of public records at no cost to state legislators acting in their official capacity and in the furtherance of legislative business or oversight.

13.title: Election And Qualification Of Officers
13.description: Authorizes the town of Barrington to fill a vacancy on the Barrington town council by combining all town council voting districts into one district for a special election in 2019.

14.title: The Rhode Island Utility Fair Share Roadway Repair Act
14.description: Requires public utilities or utility facilities to repave and repair roadways altered or excavated by them to the satisfaction of state or municipalities providing financial recovery for defective incomplete repairs.

15.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
15.title: Merit System
15.description: Allows a classified employee, whose position is not fully funded through federal loans and/or grants to seek the nomination of or to be a candidate for elective state office.

16.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
16.title: Coastal And Riverine Home Protection
16.description: Enables cities and towns to provide property tax relief to individuals who take resiliency measures to rehabilitate their property because of flood hazards.

17.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
17.title: By Possession And Prescription
17.description: Clarifies that § 34-7-4 ("right of footway denied") applies only to private rights of footway.

18.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
18.title: Relating To Behavioral Healthcare, Developmental Disabilities And Hospitals
18.description: Expands certain rights of persons with developmental disabilities.

19.title: Financial Literacy
19.description: Mandates that a program of financial literacy be taught to all students in the public high schools throughout the state of Rhode Island.

20.title: Retirement
20.description: Allows state employees who had also been a correctional officer to elect to combine their service time earned from each job, for the determination of their retirement eligibility date and calculation of retirement benefits.

21.last_action: Referred to Senate Special Legislation and Veterans Affairs
21.title: Registration Of Vehicles
21.description: Creates a special motor vehicle registration plate for The Rose Island Lighthouse Foundation, Inc.

22.title: Disability Business Enterprises
22.description: Expands the existing disability business enterprises program by allowing Veterans' Affairs, the Social Security Administration and others to verify that a business owner has a disability and is eligible for the current program.

23.title: Relating To Public Property And Works
23.description: Prohibits development of land contiguous to State House unless approved by general assembly.

24.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
24.title: Surveillance Devices
24.description: Prohibits surveillance on any public roadway in the state unless specifically authorized by statute or court order. This act would also provide for the confidentiality of information collected or stored.

25.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
25.title: Sexual Assault
25.description: Amends the definition of sexual contact in § 11-37-1 to include the intentional touching of the victim's own body at the accused's instruction.

26.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor (02/06/2019)
26.title: E-911 Uniform Emergency Telephone System Division
26.description: Mandates that the E-911 uniform emergency telephone system division develop and commence operation of a text-to-911 emergency system on January 1, 2020.

27.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
27.title: Curriculum
27.description: Requires the department of education to develop a program of age-appropriate safe relationship behavior education and training, regarding the prevention of relationship abuse, and sexual violence and harassment.

28.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
28.title: Establishing A Class Size Maximum For Kindergarten Through Grade Two
28.description: 2) (Limits public school K through 2 class size to twenty (20) students.

29.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
29.title: Sales And Use Taxes -- Liability And Computation
29.description: Creates a sales tax holiday for the days of August 10, 2019 and August 11, 2019.

30.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
30.title: Levy And Assessment Of Local Taxes
30.description: Allows local tax assessment to be based on last revaluation or current FMV, whichever is greater.

32.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
32.title: Payments To Fire Companies
32.description: Provides for an appropriation of state funds to cities and towns who are members of the Narragansett Bay marine task force (NBMTF) for the maintenance of boats providing services to Narragansett Bay.

33.title: Retail Licenses
33.description: Exempts property located at 122 North Main Street in the city of Woonsocket from the provision requiring it to be located a certain distance from objectors/schools/churches regarding the issuance of retail liquor licenses.

35.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
35.title: Official State Astronomer
35.description: Creates the honorary, unpaid, position of the official state astronomer to be appointed by the secretary of state for a term of five (5) years.

36.title: Relating To Animals And Animal Husbandry
36.description: Provides that the trapping and subsequent release of any unowned feral or free roaming cat for the purpose of spaying or neutering of the cat shall not be considered abandonment.

37.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
37.title: Cosmetic Labeling
37.description: Requires that all cosmetics manufactured, sold, delivered, or held for offering to be sold contain a label that completely and accurately lists all of its component ingredients.

38.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
38.title: Commission On Standards And Training
38.description: Requires mandatory training standards for police officers and trainees, in identifying, responding, and handling all incidents involving any person with a developmental disability.

39.title: Comprehensive Community -- Police Relationship Act Of 2015
39.description: Requires driver education programs to teach applicants prohibitions/obligations relating to traffic stops and procedure for filing complaint for any violations

40.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
40.title: Hearing Aid Dealers And Fitters
40.description: Prohibits the sale and/or delivery of hearing aids directly to the consumer through the Internet or direct mail unless the consumer has a valid certificate of need, and would provide for criminal penalties for violations.

41.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
41.title: School Committees And Superintendents
41.description: Requires school committees to provide transportation for any student who resides two (2) or more miles from school.

44.title: Professional Development
44.description: Provides for professional development opportunities relating to reading disabilities and would require two (2) hours of professional development instruction pertaining to reading disabilities for certain general education teachers.

45.title: Animal Care
45.description: Prohibits pet shops from offering for sale cats or dogs that are not obtained from an animal shelter, dog pound or animal rescue. Further prohibits any person from selling, exchanging, trading, bartering or displaying any dog or cat in public.

46.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
46.title: Cruelty To Animals
46.description: Prohibits declawing on a cat or other animal, unless a licensed veterinarian has determined that the procedure is necessary for a therapeutic purpose.

47.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
47.title: First Responders
47.description: Establishes an annual day of special observance day to honor Rhode Island's first responders on October 28.

48.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
48.title: Residential Landlord And Tenant Act
48.description: Requires the sealing of any district court file, where a resolution of a trespass and eviction complaint results in a verdict for the tenant and no appeal is taken.

50.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
50.title: Relating To Motor And Other Vehicles
50.description: Makes the owner of any vehicle not inspected as required by §§ 31-38-3 or 31-38-4 responsible for any fines or penalties imposed as a result of non-inspection and would prohibit any law enforcement officer from citing the operator of said vehicle.

51.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
51.title: Motor Vehicles Reparation Act
51.description: Penalizes driving any motor vehicle that is required to be registered in this or any other state without insurance and without proof of insurance.

52.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
52.title: Accidents And Accident Reports
52.description: Increases the penalties and fines for the various motor vehicle offenses involving leaving the scene of an accident.

53.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
53.title: Motor Vehicle Offenses
53.description: Increases the penalties for driving so as to endanger, death resulting, by increasing the maximum term of imprisonment from ten (10) years to twenty (20) years, and the maximum term of license suspension from five (5) to ten (10) years.

55.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
55.title: Lobbyist Political Contributions
55.description: Prohibits lobbyists from making any political contributions to any member of the general assembly from January 1 through July 1 in any year, unless the general assembly adjourns for the year prior to July 1.

56.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
56.title: 911 Emergency Telephone Number Act
56.description: Makes filing false alarm/false information using 911 system with emergency response likely to/does cause death/serious bodily injury a felony with prison time 16 mos-3 years, $10,000 fine, both with individual liable for reasonable response costs.

57.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
57.title: Identification And Apprehension Of Criminals
57.description: Allows expungement of multiple felony convictions for non-violent felonies 20 years after sentence completed.

58.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
58.title: Bail And Recognizance
58.description: Establishes procedures for the Courts to establish non-monetary bail for pretrial release of detainees who are deemed eligible following an investigation and report submitted by the pretrial services unit utilizing the risk assessment tool.

60.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Ten Trees Group, Inc.
60.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Ten Trees Group, Inc.

61.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
61.title: General Regulatory Provisions
61.description: Prohibits the practice of patient brokering and provides penalties and enforcement.

62.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
62.title: Regulatory Powers Of Administration
62.description: Provides that any rate increase with respect to electric distribution companies would be no greater than the increase in the Consumer Price Index or five and one-half percent (5.5%), whichever is greater.

63.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
63.title: Pharmaceutical Cost Transparency
63.description: Requires the identification of prescription drugs on which the state spends significant health care dollars due to increase in costs and requires the drug's manufacturers to provide relevant information and documentation to justify costs increases.

64.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
64.title: Unfair Sales Practices
64.description: Prohibits price-gouging of prescribed drugs or pharmaceuticals in times of market emergency or market shortages and makes violators guilty of a felony and subject to injunctive relief.

65.title: Validating And Ratifying An Amendment To The Home Rule Charter Of The City Of Central Falls
65.description: Validates and ratify amendments to the Home Rule Charter of the city of Central Falls which were adopted and approved by the electors of the city on November 6, 2018.

66.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
66.title: Minimum Wages
66.description: Raises the existing minimum wage of ten dollars and fifty cents ($10.50) to eleven dollars and fifty cents ($11.50) on January 1, 2020, and then increase to twelve dollars and fifty cents ($12.50) on January 1, 2021.

68.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
68.title: Sales And Use Taxes -- Enforcement And Collection
68.description: Eliminates the ten dollar ($10.00) fee requirement for the sales tax permit.

69.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
69.title: Federal Aid
69.description: Requires free lunches to be provided for all elementary and secondary students attending public schools, to the extent state and federal funds are available.

70.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
70.title: Housing Resources -- Homeless Shelters
70.description: Creates a commission to establish homeless shelter standards.

71.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
71.title: Revenue Estimating Conferences
71.description: Changes the dates of the R.E.C. meeting to the last ten (10) of April and the first ten (10) days of November of each year.

72.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
72.title: Public Transit Authority
72.description: Enables the RI public transit authority (RIPTA) to work with the Massachusetts Bay Transit authority (MBTA) to allow commuter rail passes to be used as dual passes for both RIPTA and MBTA.

73.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
73.title: Emergency Shelters
73.description: Establishes rules and procedures for licensing emergency shelters, including setting minimum standards and prohibiting the charging of fees to the residents.

74.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
74.title: Payday Loans
74.description: Regulates interest rates and terms for payday loans.

75.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
75.title: Child Care -- State Subsidies
75.description: Expands the tiered-rate structure for childcare assistance program to meet federal benchmark for access to high-quality childcare for all age groups of children.

76.title: Foundation Level School Support
76.description: Permits the town of Tiverton to be prospectively reimbursed at the forty percent (40%) floor of the housing aid share ratio on projects completed before June 30, 2010.

77.title: Statewide Site Readiness Fund
77.description: Creates the statewide site readiness fund, a state sponsored fund for the preparation of shared ready commercial, industrial and manufacturing property in the state.

78.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
78.title: Department Of Transportation
78.description: Requires DOT and Commerce Corporation to coordinate with senior citizens housing complexes/centers to minimize economic and financial impact of road works projects.

79.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
79.title: Making An Appropriation To Pay Certain Vietnam Bonuses
79.description: Appropriates the sum of two hundred dollars ($200) for the fiscal year ending June 30, 2019, for payment of the Vietnam bonus of James A. Falcon of East Providence, Rhode Island.

80.title: Animal Abuser Registry Act
80.description: Creates the "animal abuser registry act" which would require all persons convicted of crimes involving animal abuse to register with an online registry to be established and maintained by the attorney general's office.

81.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
81.title: The Rhode Island Unborn Child Protection From Dismemberment Abortion Act
81.description: Defines and prohibits dismemberment abortions with certain exceptions.

82.title: Explosives, Fireworks, And Pyrotechnics
82.description: Prohibits the use of display fireworks, or aerial consumer fireworks without a permit between the hours of 12:00 a.m. and 7:00 a.m. on any day and makes a violation of this permit requirement a civil violation punishable by a fine of $75 and court costs.

83.title: General Regulatory Provisions - Deceptive Trade Practices
83.description: Requires retail establishments to accept cash in payment for goods and services.

84.title: Validating And Ratifying An Amendment To The Home Rule Charter Of The Town Of Middletown
84.description: Validates and ratify amendments to the Home Rule Charter of the town of Middletown, which amendments were adopted and approved by the electors of the town of Middletown on November 6, 2018.

85.title: Health And Safety Of Pupils
85.description: Allows students in public schools to possess and use sunscreen.

86.title: Upholstered Furniture And Child Products Safety
86.description: Increases amount of flame retardant chemicals contained in residential upholstered bedding/furniture manufactured/ sold in state from 100 ppm to 1,000 ppm effective January 1, 2020.

87.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
87.title: Accident And Sickness Insurance Policies
87.description: Requires insurance coverage for non-opioid treatment alternatives.

88.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
88.title: Hearing Aids
88.description: Increases insurance coverage for hearing aids from one thousand five hundred dollars ($1,500) to two thousand dollars ($2,000), per ear, every three years. In addition, the amount of insurance coverage would no longer be based on the age of the recipient.

89.title: The Reproductive Privacy Act
89.description: Serves to codify the privacy rights guaranteed by the decision reached in the United States Supreme Court case of Roe v. Wade, 410 U.S. 113 (1973) and its progeny.

90.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
90.title: The Edward O. Hawkins And Thomas C. Slater Medical Marijuana Act
90.description: Requires compassion centers to post conspicuous signs warning of the dangers of marijuana when used by pregnant or breastfeeding women.

91.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
91.title: The Reproductive Health Care Act
91.description: Codifies the current state of the law on reproductive rights in Rhode Island by incorporating the protections set forth in Roe v. Wade limiting restrictions on an individual's decision to terminate a pregnancy.

93.title: Condominium Law--resale Of Units
93.description: Imposes a penalty against a condominium association that fails to deliver a resale certificate within ten (10) days of a request by a unit owner.

94.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
94.title: Relating To Fish And Wildlife
94.description: Prohibits the practice of importing a wild animal into the state, which animal is not native or indigenous to the state, for the purpose of conducting canned hunting.

95.title: The Gold Star Family Highway
95.description: Provides an honorary name to a portion of highway on Chopmist Hill Road from Route 44 in Chepachet to the southern boundary of the town of Glocester, as the Gold Star Family Highway.

96.title: Relating To The Town Of North Smithfield
96.description: Ratifies the Home Rule Charter amendments adopted and approved by the electors of North Smithfield on November 6, 2018.

97.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
97.title: Residential Solar Energy - Disclosure And Homeowners Bill Of Rights Act
97.description: Grants solar energy system retail purchasers protections requiring disclosures in the retail/lease documents the right to cancel/rescind agreement within 90 days prior to installation/notice of liens filed on their property.

98.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
98.title: Adoption Of Children
98.description: Permits a petition for adoption, and if necessary, termination of parental rights, to be filed by a grandparent(s) without the noncustodial parents' consent in certain circumstances.

99.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
99.title: Fair Housing Practices
99.description: Prohibits discrimination in housing against those persons who have a lawful source of income.

100.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
100.title: Eligibility To Vote
100.description: Allows individuals, who have not reached the age of eighteen (18) years, to vote in a primary election, as long as the voter will be eighteen (18) as of the date of the general or special election.

102.title: Assisted Living Residence Licensing Act
102.description: Allows some persons, who do not otherwise qualify to reside in a special care unit in an assisted living residence to get into that unit under certain circumstances.

103.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
103.title: Physical Therapists
103.description: Includes in the practice of physical therapy ordering diagnostic images and studies provided they are performed and interpreted by other licensed health care professionals.

104.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
104.title: Firefighters' Arbitration
104.description: Continues all provisions of firefighter's collective bargaining agreements until a successor agreement has been reached or an interest arbitration award has been rendered.

105.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
105.title: Municipal Police Arbitration
105.description: Extends provisions of an existing collective bargaining agreement for municipal police arbitration purposes until a successor agreement is reached or an interest arbitration award is rendered.

106.title: Relating To Businesses And Professions
106.description: Enables Rhode Island businesses to voluntarily promulgate standards to guide its business activities in a sustainable and responsible manner, as well as metrics for assessing whether it has met its objectives.

108.last_action: Referred to Senate Special Legislation and Veterans Affairs
108.title: Registration Of Vehicles -- Special Plate For Masonic Grand Lodge Charities Of Rhode Island
108.description: Authorizes a special license plate for MASONIC GRAND LODGE CHARITIES OF RHODE ISLAND, specify the minimum order and govern the amount and distribution of the fee surcharge.

109.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
109.title: Residence Of Children For School Purposes
109.description: Requires the state to reimburse the city or town for any costs associated with transporting children placed in foster care to an educational facility outside the regional transportation district.

110.title: Relating To Making Revised Appropriations In Support Of Fy 2019
110.description: Relating To Making Revised Appropriations In Support Of Fy 2019

111.title: Relating To Making Appropriations In Support Of Fy 2020
111.description: Relating To Making Appropriations In Support Of Fy 2020

112.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
112.title: Personal Income Tax
112.description: Excludes pension income from taxation under the same circumstances as social security exclusion.

113.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
113.title: Sales And Use Taxes--liability And Computation
113.description: Adds urns and shrouds, prayer cards and other items customarily sold or provided by a funeral director to those funeral items which are already exempt from sales and use taxes.

116.title: In Accordance With Rhode Island General Law Section 16-7-44 Approving The Issuance Of $160,000,000 General Obligation Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness Of The City Of Providence To Fund The School Capital Improvements Plan For The Fiscal Years 2019-2024
116.description: Serves as the enabling act required by Rhode Island General Laws § 16-7-44 in order for the interest on bonds issued in support of school housing projects to be eligible for state housing aid reimbursement.

117.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
117.title: Motion Picture Production Tax Credits
117.description: Removes the seven million ($7,000,000) dollar limit allowing the motion picture production company tax credit to be carried forward. Increases the total credits that may be issued up to twenty five million ($25,000,000.)

118.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
118.title: Mental Health Services For All Students
118.description: Directs that services provided by school social workers and certified school psychologists would be included as health care related services eligible for federal Medicaid reimbursement.

119.title: Rhode Island Uniform Commercial Driver's License Act
119.description: Permits applicants for commercial driver's licenses to carry over parts of the required examinations that they passed for a period of two years and require them to retake those portions not passed.

120.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
120.title: Establishing The "firearm Safety Trigger Lock Distribution Program"
120.description: Creates a firearm safety lock distribution program administered by the department of health.

121.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
121.title: Offenses Pertaining To Schools
121.description: Provides an exception to required school immunizations for pupils whose personal, philosophical, or religious beliefs are contrary to immunization and/or testing.

122.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
122.title: Relating To Education-access To Advanced Placement Courses For All Students Act
122.description: Establishes a process for the Community College of Rhode Island, Rhode Island College and the University of Rhode Island to accept for college credit an advanced placement subject test score of three (“qualified”) or better.

123.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
123.title: Mental Health Law
123.description: Includes licensed advanced practice registered nurses (APRN), certified in psychiatric/mental health, as qualified to certify the need for mental health treatment in certain patients.

124.title: Americanization Of Schools
124.description: Repeals requirement that persons between 16 and 21 who cannot speak, read or write English to attend classes until they learn (minimum 200 hours). Also repeals fines and institutional commitment for failure to take such classes.

125.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
125.title: Duties Of Utilities And Carriers
125.description: Requires electric transmission and electric distribution companies to conduct periodic equipment inspections.

127.title: Causes Of Action
127.description: Statute of limitation for childhood sex abuse claims extended to 35 years.

128.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor (03/19/2019)
128.title: Relating To Criminal Offenses-weapons
128.description: Raises the legal age to purchase or sell a rifle or shotgun from 18 years of age to 21 years of age and restricts permits to minors for sporting or training to age 21.

130.title: In Accordance With Rhode Island General Laws Sec. 16-7-44 Approving The Issuance Of Not To Exceed $20,000,000 Lease Revenue Bonds Or Other Evidences Of Indebtedness By The Providence Public Buildings Authority To Finance The Acquisition, Design, Construction, Repair, Rehabilitation, Replacement And Improvement Of Health And Safety Projects At The City's Schools And School Facilities, Including But Not Limited To Building Envelope Repair, Mechanical, Electrical And Plumbing Improvements, Fire Code Compliance And Pest Control, Including Design And Feasibility, Engineering Or Other Studies
130.description: Serves as the enabling act for the Providence Public Buildings Authority school housing projects to be eligible for state housing aid reimbursement.

131.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
131.title: Labor And Payment Of Debts
131.description: Amends the definition of public works so that it would include any public works projects performed for any city or town or quasi-municipal entity and the state and any quasi-state entity.

132.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor (03/14/2019)
132.title: "the Federal Furloughed Employees Protection Act"
132.description: Provides protections to residents of this state furloughed by the federal government relating to civil proceedings, credit card transactions, payments relating to mortgages, leases and installment contracts.

133.title: Establishing A Program Within The Department Of Health To Address Alzheimer's Disease
133.description: Establishes the Rhode Island Program to address Alzheimer's disease.

134.title: Pharmacies
134.description: Increases the state board of pharmacy from nine (9) to eleven (11) members by adding two (2) pharmacy technicians.

135.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
135.title: Independent Charter Schools [see Title 16 Chapter 97 - The Rhode Island Board Of Education Act]
135.description: Includes "admissions criteria for career preparation programs" as an enrollment procedure required to be included in proposals for the creation or expansion of charter schools.

136.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
136.title: Establishment Of Charter Public Schools
136.description: Authorizes school committees of a host district to appoint one designee to the board of directors of the governing body of any charter public school.

137.title: Retail Licenses -- Special Events License
137.description: Permits cities and towns to issue special events liquor licenses to permit the equivalent of one-day licenses one day each month.

140.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
140.title: Preliminary Proceedings In District Courts
140.description: Limits the period of a filing of a criminal complaint to the maximum term of the penalty prescribed by the offense.

141.title: Validating And Ratifying Amendments To The Home Rule Charter
141.description: Ratifies and validates the amendments to the Barrington Home Rule Charter which were approved by the electors of the town of Barrington at the polls on November 6, 2018.

142.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
142.title: Airports And Landing Fields
142.description: Increases the amount of reimbursement funds required to be paid by the Rhode Island airport corporation to the city of Warwick for municipal services.

143.title: Withholding Of Tax
143.description: Provides that the non-resident withholding requirement for a corporation that sells real estate be consistent with the seven percent (7%) corporate income tax rate.

144.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
144.title: Health Care Accessibility And Quality Assurance Act
144.description: Redefines the term "covered services" as used to describe applicable subscriber agreements between a health care entity and a dentist, to exclude waiting period provisions.

146.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
146.title: The World Language And Dual Language Immersion Act
146.description: Establishes and requires funding for a world language and dual language immersion program.

147.title: Sales And Use Taxes -- Liability Computation
147.description: Exempts from tax burial containers, liners and vaults and items sold by funeral directors to conduct funeral services.

148.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
148.title: Historic Preservation Tax Credits 2013
148.description: Repeals the sunset provision of chapter 33.6 of title 44 which grants tax credits to individuals or companies redeveloping historic structures.

149.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
149.title: Conservation And Preservation Restrictions On Real Property
149.description: Requires conservation and preservation restrictions to be liberally interpreted in favor of the grants awarded.

150.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
150.title: Costs
150.description: Provides that a defendant's qualification for the services of public defender constitutes prima facie evidence of indigency and limited ability to pay court costs and no costs shall be ordered unless procedures for determining ability to pay are followed.

151.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
151.title: Mechanics' Liens
151.description: Provides for the release of unperfected mechanics' liens by the filing of an affidavit.

152.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
152.title: The Rhode Island Right To Life Act Of 2019
152.description: Provides the right to life is guaranteed by the state of Rhode Island and is vested in each person at fertilization.

153.title: Divorce And Separation -- Child Support
153.description: Extends child support for children attending college and living with custodial parent; restricts the court's power to modify existing orders of child support regarding arrearages owed to custodial parent even if the parties agree to waive.

154.last_action: Referred to Senate Health and Human Services
154.title: Bedding And Upholstered Furniture
154.description: Directs the department of health to promulgate rules and regulations to provide for clinical oversight of the use of therapeutic beds and cribs which are prescribed by a physician for use by a minor.

155.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
155.title: Department Of Health -- Adult Day Care Program Licensure
155.description: Prevents promulgating any regulation discriminating against/giving preference to the number/percentage of participants receiving adult day care services based upon their age/age group.

156.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
156.title: Rhode Island Best Rx Prescription Drug Discount Program For The Uninsured
156.description: Requires that enrollees in the Rhode Island best RX Prescription drug discount program for the uninsured are not charged a copay for their prescriptions.

157.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
157.title: Establishing An Office Of Inspector General
157.description: Establishes the office of inspector general as an independent administrative agency charged with the responsibility to investigate, detect, and prevent fraud, waste, abuse, and mismanagement in the expenditure of public funds.

158.title: Travel Insurance Act
158.description: Creating the travel insurance act to establish comprehensive/uniform regulatory framework for travel insurance. Clarifying/bolstering enforcement authority over participants in the travel insurance industry.

159.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
159.title: Relating To Health And Safety
159.description: Encourages commercial property owners to install vehicle barriers at their retail establishment locations, and also permits insurers to consider the installation of such barriers to provide a discount on the owner's insurance policy.

161.title: Election And Qualifications Of Officers
161.description: Allows the town of Coventry to combine voting precincts for a special election for the school committee in 2019. Once the precincts are combined, the canvassers shall advertise such combination at least seven (7) days prior to the election.

162.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
162.title: Establishing A Small Business Development Fund
162.description: Establishes a small business develop fund designed to encourage the formation of private capital investment by federally licensed investment companies in underserved small business, leveraged by delayed, at-risk stream of tax credits.

163.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor (06/27/2019)
163.title: Relating To Alcoholic Beverages
163.description: Clarifies the number of ounces a manufacturer of malt beverages is allowed to sell on their premises as twenty-four (24) twelve ounce (12 oz.) bottles or cans, or twenty-four (24) sixteen ounce (16 oz.) bottles or cans.

165.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
165.title: Sales And Use Taxes--liability And Computation--lease Payments
165.description: Prohibits the collection of a sales or use tax on that portion of a motor vehicle lease payment representing taxes payable by the lessor on the leased motor vehicle.

166.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
166.title: Quonset Development Corporation
166.description: Authorizes the Quonset development corp. to borrow up to $1,000,000 for operational purposes, including from the RI infrastructure bank, which debt would not be a debt of the state and would be secured only by the Quonset development corporation's assets.

168.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
168.title: Property Subject To Taxation
168.description: Provides that a nonprofit hospital facility converted from for-profit hospital facility would have a payment in lieu of tax agreement with the applicable city or town or subject to a municipal payment equal to sixty-five percent (65%) of the tax due.

170.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
170.title: Sales And Use Taxes - Liability And Computation
170.description: Exempts from the sale or use tax that portion of a motor vehicle lease payment collected for tangible personal property tax, municipal property tax, excise, or any other similar tax.

171.title: House Office Of Economics
171.description: Establishes an office of economics to assist the house of representatives during its review of the financial impact of proposed legislation.

172.title: Psychologists
172.description: Includes licensed school psychologists under the provisions of the general laws governing the regulations of psychologists.

173.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
173.title: Physical Therapy Copay
173.description: Limits copays, coinsurance or office deductible for services of a physical therapist to the amount authorized for medical osteopathic physician office visits.

174.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
174.title: Hunting And Hunting Safety
174.description: Requires any person who sustains an injury to themselves or causes an injury to another while hunting or trapping to report the injury to the department of environmental management immediately.

177.title: Passing, Use Of Lanes, And Rules Of The Road
177.description: Requires the driver of a vehicle overtaking another vehicle proceeding in the same direction to use a directional signal and repeals the requirement that such signal be audible.

178.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
178.title: Procedure Generally - Jury Lists
178.description: Makes persons seventy (70) years of age or older eligible for exemption from jury service.

179.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
179.title: Divorce And Separation--child Support
179.description: Extends child support obligations for non-custodial parents beyond emancipation if the children are attending a two (2) or four (4) year college and still reside with the custodial parent until such children reach the age of twenty-two (22).

182.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
182.title: Solemnization Of Marriages
182.description: Authorizes the governor to designate a justice of the peace in towns/cities or any other person to solemnize marriages upon application and payment of fee. Certificate of designation can be revoked for cause.

184.title: Video-lottery Games, Table Games And Sports Wagering
184.description: Authorizes and provide for online sports wagering through authorized hosting facilities in Rhode Island.

185.title: Pathway To Retirement Security Act For Locally Administered Pension Funds
185.description: Provides that municipal pension funds may only be diverted from the state upon the occurrence of an emergency or unforeseen circumstances and approval after a public hearing, and a minimum of 30 days prior written notice to affected employees.

186.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
186.title: Payment Of Statutory Fees
186.description: Facilitates state departments/agencies to implement electronic filing of applications for licenses/permits/ registrations/certificates by allowing state vendor to withhold commission for developing and implementing electronic filing web-based system.

187.title: Relating To Jewish Seniors Agency Of Rhode Island
187.description: Increases the authorized tax exempt holdings of Jewish Seniors Agency of Rhode Island to $2,000,000.

190.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
190.title: Board Of Medical Licensure And Discipline
190.description: Authorizes hospital medical staff to elect whether or not to participate in a maintenance of certification program, to elect medical specialty board to implement the program and prohibits insurers from denying reimbursement based solely on this election.

192.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
192.title: Education Equity And Property Tax Relief Act
192.description: Provides that the state's share of foundation education aid would follow the student, the school the student is attending, and that districts would make adjustments between themselves for and to the nearest monthly increment.

194.title: Electrolysis
194.description: Establishes the requirements for licensure and regulation of electrologists performing electrolysis and/or laser hair removal.

195.title: Curriculum [see Title 16 Chapter 97 -- The Rhode Island Board Of Education Act]
195.description: Requires that instruction in health and physical education include information provided to students that mixing opioids and alcohol can cause accidental death.

196.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
196.title: Naming State Constructions - E. Richard Durfee Road
196.description: Names a certain portion of Sand Hill Cove Road in Narragansett, "E. Richard Durfee Road".

197.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
197.title: Department Of Administration
197.description: Requires verification of hours worked on computers by contractors for professional or technical services rendered to the departments of transportation, health, human services, administration and commerce in contracts exceeding $100,000.

198.title: Dealerships
198.description: Requires motor vehicle dealers to disclose in writing that a vehicle being sold has a spare tire/ jack or is otherwise equipped in compliance with applicable law. There shall be a civil penalty of $100 for a violation under this subsection.

199.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of St. Peter's-by-the-sea, Narragansett, Rhode Island
199.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of St. Peter's-by-the-sea, Narragansett, Rhode Island

200.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
200.title: New Home Buyers Fire Protection Act
200.description: Mandates builders of new 1 and 2 family dwellings to provide written info to buyer about installation of automatic sprinkler system subject to civil penalties for violations/results of radon tests/certification of working smoke detector devices eff 1/1/20

201.title: Union Representation
201.description: Clarifies the rights and options of government employees who decide not to join their employer's exclusive bargaining unit.

202.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
202.title: Arbitration - Certified School Teachers - Municipal Employees
202.description: Makes the arbitrator's decision binding on all matters pertaining to certified public school teachers and municipal employees, including those matters involving the expenditure of money.

203.title: Relief Of Injured And Deceased Fire Fighters And Public Officers
203.description: Adds and makes correctional offices to the definition of "police officer" for the purpose of payment to their salary during line of duty illness or injury.

204.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
204.title: The Animal Rights Advisory Council
204.description: Establishes an animal rights advisory council to advise the governor and the general assembly on matters relating to animal rights, treatment, health, and safety.

205.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
205.title: Regional Vocational Schools [see Title 16 Chapter 97 -- The Rhode Island Board Of Education Act
205.description: Amend the career and technical education programs laws to provide the process by which students could attend state CTE board-approved programs in other districts.

206.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
206.title: Relating To Animals And Animal Husbandry- Use Of Animals In Medical School Lesson
206.description: Prohibits a medical school in this state from using a live animal while teaching medical procedures if there is an alternate teaching method utilized by at least one accredited school in the state.

207.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
207.title: Payment Of Wages
207.description: Eliminates repealed statute references and create a mechanism for employees to enforce their existing right to continuation of medical benefits.

209.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
209.title: Employment Security - Benefits
209.description: Increases the maximum weekly unemployment benefit rate to the higher of fifty-seven and one-half percent (57.5%) of the average weekly wages paid to the workers in the prior calendar year or six hundred thirty-six dollars ($636) per week.

210.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
210.title: Rhode Island Parental And Family Medical Leave Act
210.description: Allows an employee granted unpaid family or parental leave to substitute any accrued vacation, sick or other appropriate paid leave for any part of the unpaid leave.

211.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
211.title: Fees For State Colleges And Universities -- Veterans
211.description: Authorizes state higher education institutions to waive application and transcript fees for veterans.

212.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
212.title: Tax Credits For Contributions To Scholarship Organizations
212.description: Increases the aggregate amount of tax credits for contributions to scholarship organizations to $5,000,000 for 2020.

213.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
213.title: Highways
213.description: Repeals § 11-22-11 which prohibits the testing of the speed of a horse on a public highway and the applicable fine.

214.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
214.title: Conduct Of Election And Voting Equipment, And Supplies
214.description: Includes the general assembly elections in the risk-limiting audits within the jurisdiction of the board of elections.

215.title: Zoning Ordinances
215.description: Excludes the growth of marijuana and any of its derivatives from the provisions requiring the permitted use of plant agriculture within all city and town zoning ordinances.

217.title: Sales And Use Tax--non-collecting Retailers, Referrers, And Retail Sale Facilitators Act
217.description: Extends the requirement to collect sales tax to remote sellers in a way that conforms to a recent U.S. Supreme Court decision making it easier for states to compel collection/sales tax from retailers who do not have a physical presence in their state.

220.title: Non-erisa Covered Pension Plans
220.description: Requires that all defined pension plans, excluding certain governmental plans, which are not covered by the ERISA and have at least two hundred (200) members, comply with ERISA's annual reporting provisions.

222.title: Appropriate Disability Language
222.description: Ensures appropriate disability language is used in all job descriptions and statutes.

224.title: State Register
224.description: Requires secretary of state to collect/publish governor's executive orders on website arranged by topic rather than in numerical/chronological order.

226.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
226.title: Relating To Motor And Other Vehicles-motor Vehicle Offenses
226.description: Imposes $300 substance abuse education assessment for conviction of driving under the influence or a violation for refusal to submit to a breathalyzer. Funds would be allocated to department of behavioral health and used to fund substance abuse programs.

227.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
227.title: Expungement Of Criminal Records
227.description: Allows persons with multiple misdemeanors and felonies to seek expungement of up to six convictions provided that convictions for multiple alcohol related offenses or domestic violence offenses and crime of violence are not eligible.

231.title: Nurse Anesthetists
231.description: Permits a registered nurse who is enrolled in an accredited nurse anesthesia program to practice as a nurse anesthetist under the supervision of a certified registered nurse anesthetist or an anesthesiologist.

232.title: Equal Rights Of Blind And Deaf Persons To Public Facilities
232.description: Prohibits misrepresentation of the status of an animal as a service animal in order to acquire any right or privilege afforded disabled persons.

234.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
234.title: Public Health And Workplace Safety Act
234.description: Provides that any law or regulations which prohibits or protects a person from exposure to second-hand smoke would include second-hand marijuana smoke.

235.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
235.title: Property Subject To Taxation-veterans' Exemptions
235.description: Gives cities and towns the option of entirely exempting the homestead of a disabled veteran or their surviving spouse from taxation.

236.title: Local Planning Board Or Commission
236.description: Authorizes the Johnston town council to appoint two (2) alternate members to the Johnston planning board.

237.title: Rhode Island Uninsured Protection Fund
237.description: Extends the effective date of the Rhode Island Uninsured Protection Fund from February 1, 2019 to September 1, 2019.

238.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
238.title: Business Corporation Tax
238.description: Exempts a corporation from the minimum corporate tax for the first two (2) years following the date of incorporation.

240.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
240.title: Rhode Island Commerce Corporation
240.description: Limits the authority of the Rhode Island commerce corporation to finance any transaction to five million dollars ($5,000,000) for any one individual, business entity or project.

241.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
241.title: Estate And Transfer Taxes -- Computation
241.description: Increases net taxable estate exemption from $850,000 to $11,500,000 effective January 1, 2020.

243.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
243.title: Estate And Transfer Taxes
243.description: Repeals the chapter regarding estate and transfer taxes thus eliminating these taxes.

245.title: Single-use Plastic Straws
245.description: Prohibits a food service establishment from providing a consumer with a single-use plastic straw unless requested by the consumer.

246.title: Unemployment Benefits During Federal Government Shutdown
246.description: Enables federal employees, who are working during a government shutdown but not receiving wages, to receive unemployment benefits while they are working but not getting paid.

247.title: Registration Fees
247.description: Imposes a fee of fifty dollars ($50.00) for the registration of a camping recreational vehicle.

248.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
248.title: Nursing Loan Repayment Program
248.description: Reestablishes a nursing loan interest forgiveness program that had sunset on December 31, 2010.

249.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
249.title: Public Service Corporation Tax
249.description: Allows for accumulated depreciation reduction for physical deterioration, functional and economic obsolescence.

250.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
250.title: Department Of Health
250.description: Establishes Alzheimer's disease awareness campaign to be administered by the director of the department of health.

251.title: Food Donations
251.description: Repeals the current chapter of the general laws regarding immunity for food donors to food banks, and would adopt a new chapter with comprehensive immunity provisions for persons involved in donating food to food banks.

256.title: Vital Records
256.description: Requires funeral directors/agents to notify secretary of state and the chairperson of the board of canvassers upon filing death certificate for the purpose of removal from the roles of registered voters.

257.title: Relating To Criminal Procedure
257.description: Enables innocent persons who have been wrongfully convicted of a crime to petition the presiding justice of the superior court for an award of compensation and damages.

259.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
259.title: Operation Of Railroads Generally
259.description: Requires that trains used in connection with the movement of freight be operated by a crew of at least two (2) persons.

261.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
261.title: Correctional Institutions - Parole
261.description: Provides that prisoners who committed offenses prior to age eighteen (18) and were sentenced as adults would be eligible for parole after completing fifteen (15) years of their sentence.

262.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
262.title: Proceedings In Family Court
262.description: Prohibits any questioning of a juvenile who is suspected of delinquent or criminal behavior, unless the parent of guardian of the juvenile is present, or unless an attorney is present or the juvenile and their parents have waived their presence.

263.title: Relating To State Affairs And Government
263.description: Codifies the public corruption and white collar crime unit within the department of attorney general.

265.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
265.title: Work On Holidays And Sundays
265.description: Repeals § 5-3-7 of the general laws which gives the director of the department of labor and training the authority to exempt certain classes of employees from receiving overtime pay for Sunday and holiday work.

268.title: Fair Employment Practices
268.description: Tolls the statute of limitations during the period of investigation by the commission for human rights for certain violations for up to one year, starting on the date the charge is filed until the date the commission makes a determination.

271.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
271.title: Sexual Harassment, Education And Training In The Workplace
271.description: Mandates sexual harassment training for employees and supervisors of employers of fifty (50) or more employees. It would recommend an annual climate survey for employers.

272.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
272.title: Unlawful Employment Practices
272.description: Prohibits an employer/employment agency/labor organization/or employee/to directly/indirectly commit any act declared to be an unlawful employment practice/it being the legislative intent that individuals would be held personally liable for such conduct.

275.title: Prompt Processing Of Claims
275.description: Provides greater details to be considered when deciding if there has been substantial compliance with the statutes requiring the prompt processing and payment of health insurance claims.

277.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
277.title: Open Meetings
277.description: Allows school committees to add item(s) to their agendas for the purposes of discussion only without having to publish notice of the additional item(s).

278.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
278.title: Procedure In Particular Actions-selection Pool For Court Appointed Receivers
278.description: Requires that the selection pool for court appointed receivers be composed of at least ten percent (10%) of receivers who are persons of color.

281.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
281.title: Return Of Seized Property
281.description: Requires state and municipal authorities to return forfeited property 90 days after the underlying substantive matter is concluded in the owner's favor unless the property seized is a forfeitable controlled substance.

285.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
285.title: Shows And Exhibitions
285.description: Provides regulations for the reselling of tickets for entertainment events including regulations for refunds, counterfeit ticket sales, delivery of tickets and deceptive ticket sales websites.

288.title: Designers Of Individual Sewage Disposal Systems
288.description: Provides that professional engineers who are registered and authorized to practice by the Rhode Island state board of registration for professional engineers be deemed to have met the qualifications for a designer's license.

289.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
289.title: Teachers Rights
289.description: Broadens the definition of "teacher" and create a comprehensive bill of rights for school teachers.

290.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
290.title: Laboratories
290.description: Restores provisions of chapter 16.2 of title 23 as well as all of chapter 16.3 of title 23, which were repealed or deleted in the 2015 Budget Act, relating to definitions, licensing, and the operation of medical laboratories.

291.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor (02/27/2019)
291.title: Benefit Determination And Utilization Review Act
291.description: Provides reviews of health insurance determinations as to insurance coverage would be conducted by a medical specialist.

292.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
292.title: The Education Equity And Property Tax Relief Act
292.description: Extends the reimbursement to a school district or municipality for the employment of a new hire school resource officer from a period of three (3) years to ongoing.

293.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
293.title: Central Falls Retiree Pension Benefits
293.description: Provides increases in the pension benefit to persons covered by the Central Falls retirees' settlement agreement.

295.title: Retirement System - Contributions And Benefits
295.description: Provides a stipend up to four hundred fifty dollars ($450) to retirees in years there are no cost of living adjustments.

297.title: Musical And Theatrical Production Tax Credits
297.description: Extends the period for musical and theatrical productions to obtain tax credits to July 1, 2024.

298.title: Retirement System Contributions And Benefits
298.description: Requires that retirement contributions be deposited or remitted to the retirement system within three (3) days.

299.title: Comprehensive Discharge Planning
299.description: Amends current law so that, as part of a comprehensive discharge plan, a hospital would be allowed to try to contact the patient's emergency contact and the certified peer recovery specialists, in accordance with federal law.

300.title: Medicare Supplement Insurance Policies
300.description: Provides that Medicare supplement policies be made available to Medicare eligible disabled individuals under the age of sixty-five (65).

301.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
301.title: Medical Assistance
301.description: Repeals the automatic phase out of the nursing facility reimbursement price based methodology.

302.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
302.title: Micro Zone Economic Revitalization Act
302.description: Creates micro zones in distressed areas to stimulate economic revitalization, employment opportunities, and business development through the redevelopment of obsolete, dilapidated and abandoned industrial and commercial structures.

304.title: The Municipal Water Supply Systems Transactions Act
304.description: Authorizes any municipal water supply system, any regional water quality management district commission to enter into a transaction with municipal water supply systems or regional water quality management district commissions.

305.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
305.title: Inspection Of Motor Vehicles
305.description: Requires the first inspection of any new vehicle within five (5) years from the date of purchase. If the vehicle is sold within five (5) years, the new owner must obtain an inspection sticker before the current sticker expires.

306.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
306.title: Maintenance Of Town And State Highways
306.description: Requires that any altered roadway be restored to the same or better condition than that which existed prior to the alteration.

307.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
307.title: Convention Center Authority Act
307.description: Provides a bidding procedure for naming rights to the Rhode Island Convention Center.

308.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
308.title: Cigarette And Other Tobacco Products Tax
308.description: Permits cigarette distributors to have partial rolls or sheets of unused tax stamps redeemed by the tax administrator for ninety-eight percent (98%) of their face value.

309.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
309.title: Personal Income Tax - Military Retirement
309.description: Excludes for the purposes of RI state income taxes, the first $25,000 of military retirement income, paid by the state or federal government to persons 60 years or older.

311.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
311.title: Real Estate Conveyance Tax
311.description: Exempts a housing development financed with federal low income tax credits, as well as Rhode Island non-profit corporations or entities which are tax exempt and own real estate under an affordable housing program, from real estate conveyance tax.

312.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
312.title: State Tax Officials -- Sales And Use Taxes -- Enforcement And Collection
312.description: Provides that a tax payment shall be paid by midnight on the date in which the tax becomes due and payable, and reduces the amount of penalty for taxes unpaid from a maximum of twenty-one percent (21%) to ten percent (10%).

314.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
314.title: Relating To Education-transportation Of School Pupils Beyond City And Town Limits
314.description: Moves the towns of Foster, Glocester, Lincoln and Smithfield to the Region I school bus district within the state in order to provide bus transportation.

315.title: The Health Care Services Funding Plan Act
315.description: Requires Tricare to pay the healthcare services funding contributions for their contribution enrollees.

316.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
316.title: The Hospital Conversion Act
316.description: Expands the health services council from twelve (12) to twenty-four (24) members and amends the hospital conversion act relative to disclosure.

317.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
317.title: Medical Assistance - Long-term Care Services And Finance Reforms
317.description: Requires that the rate for hospice providers, delivering hospice care in a skilled nursing facility, not exceed ninety-five percent (95%) of the rate paid for non-hospice care in a skilled nursing facility.

319.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
319.title: Audio And Video Recordings
319.description: Requires audio and video recordings of certain open meetings of municipal government to be transmitted to the secretary of state's office.

320.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
320.title: Budgeting - Legislative Grants
320.description: Provides that legislative grants would be awarded by senators and representatives in equal prorated shares, one half (1/2) in each chamber.

321.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
321.title: Public Corporation Debt Management
321.description: Prohibits the general assembly and any governmental or quasi-governmental entity created by it, from issuing moral obligation bonds not secured by the full faith and credit of the state or revenues.

322.title: Relating To Waters And Navigation
322.description: Directs the general treasurer to remit to the town of Scituate 5% of the monies received from the Providence water supply board to reimburse the town for services provided to the Scituate Reservoir.

325.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
325.title: Relating To State Budget
325.description: Requires that the governor submit a zero-based budget to the general assembly. The zero-based budget shall be phased in over a five (5) year period.

326.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
326.title: The Motor Vehicle Sales Tax Equity Act
326.description: Exempts the trade-in values of motorcycles from sales tax and exempts from the state sales tax the trade-in value of any pickup truck under eight thousand one hundred pounds (8,100 lbs.) gross weight.

328.title: Business Corporation Tax And Franchise Tax
328.description: Lowers the minimum corporate tax imposed from four hundred dollars ($400) to three hundred seventy-five dollars ($375.00).

329.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
329.title: Personal Income Tax Credit
329.description: Provides an income tax credit of twenty-five percent (25%) of an elderly resident taxpayer's primary residence water and sewer bills, not to exceed $250.

330.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
330.title: Long-term Health Care Goals And Values--the Rhode Island Alzheimer's Disease Brain Bank Task Force
330.description: Establishes a task force to assess the need, desirability, feasibility and cost of establishing a brain bank for Alzheimer's disease research.

331.title: Commission On The Deaf And Hard-of-hearing
331.description: Provides conditions to lawfully permit a state employee to be employed as an interpreter or a CART provider outside of the normal working hours.

332.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
332.title: Mandatory Coverage For All Blood Testing Services
332.description: Mandates blood testing services coverage by accident/sickness/nonprofit hospital/nonprofit medical service corporation/HMOs effective 1/1/20.

333.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
333.title: Unanticipated Out-of-network Bills For Health Care Services
333.description: Protects people with health insurance from surprise medical bills for emergency and other services by requiring a non-participating health care provider to bill an insured party only for a co-payment, or deductible.

334.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
334.title: Elderly Affairs Department
334.description: Eliminates the requirement of proving willfulness, regarding physical or emotional abuse, or neglect, of an elderly person.

336.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
336.title: Protection Of Children, Families And Firefighters--flame Retardants
336.description: Protects the health and safety of children, families and firefighters from exposure to harmful flame retardants contained in bedding, carpeting, children's products, residential upholstered furniture or window treatments. Effective January 1, 2020.

337.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
337.title: Council On Elementary And Secondary Education
337.description: Requires the council of elementary and secondary education take into consideration the time and cost of transporting students across municipal boundaries.

338.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
338.title: Screening And Education Of Children With Dyslexia And Related Disorders
338.description: Requires public schools to provide screening for dyslexia/related disorders/establish approp. treatment and/or education plan for students starting in school year 2020-2021/creates study comm. for 2 schools dedicated to instruction of dyslexic children.

339.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
339.title: Healthy Beverage Act
339.description: Creates the "Healthy Beverage Act" which would require that children's meals offered by restaurants include certain healthy beverage options if the beverage is automatically included in the meal.

341.title: Dual Enrollment Equal Opportunity Act
341.description: Extends the benefits of the dual enrollment equal opportunity act to cover home-schooled students.

342.title: Child Advocate Office
342.description: Adds the requirement that in DCYF cases resulting in a fatality or near fatality of a child, one of the requirements for the office of the child advocate to investigate the case would be the child or the child's family had prior contact with the DCYF.

344.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
344.title: School Funds And Property
344.description: Requires school districts to maintain classroom temperatures and humidity levels within targeted levels.

345.title: Seizure Of Animals Being Cruelly Treated
345.description: Authorizes certain state and municipal agents to take possession of animals found abandoned or neglected, and to proceed to provide all necessary care and treatment for the animal.

346.last_action: Committee recommended Substitute A be held for further study
346.title: Uniform Controlled Substances Act
346.description: Excludes chronic intractable pain from the definition of "acute pain management", for purposes of prescribing, administering and dispensing controlled substances by a practitioner.

347.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
347.title: Board Of Education Qualifications
347.description: Requires each member of the board of education to have experience in a position of higher education.

349.title: Arbitration - Continuance Of Contractual Provisions
349.description: Provides for the extension of certain contractual provisions in a school teachers' collective bargaining agreement if the parties are engaged in negotiations.

350.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
350.title: Council On Postsecondary Education [see Title 16 Chapter 97 -- The Rhode Island Board Of Education Act]
350.description: Requires that the contractual provisions contained in an otherwise expired collective bargaining agreement with all full and adjunct professors at state universities and colleges would continue until a successor agreement has been reached.

351.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
351.title: Fair Employment Practices And The General Assembly
351.description: Makes the fair employment practices act expressly applicable to individuals elected to state public officer or any political subdivision thereof and would provide civil liability for a person who directly or indirectly violates the chapter.

352.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
352.title: Relating To Labor And Labor Relations
352.description: Requires that collective bargaining agreements would be posted on government websites prior to execution.

353.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
353.title: Employment Security - Seasonal Employees
353.description: Creates a seasonal employment designation for purposes of unemployment benefits, which would allow employers hiring employees for less than twenty (20) weeks to apply for a seasonal determination by the director of the department of labor and training.

354.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
354.title: Employment Of Women And Children
354.description: Requires children who seek a special limited work permit to successfully complete a training program to include workers' rights, workplace health and safety, and workers' compensation, established and funded by the department of labor and training.

355.title: Recordation Of Honorable Discharges
355.description: Provides a petition process to have a discharge from service recorded as honorable for members of the armed services separated from service with a general or other than honorable discharge due solely to their sexual orientation/gender identity/expression.

356.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
356.title: Rhode Island Global Warming Solutions Act
356.description: Establishes the Rhode Island global warming solutions act to reduce carbon emissions across various sectors of the local economy.

357.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
357.title: General Provisions
357.description: Provides for the authorized taking of mushrooms from public lands.

358.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
358.title: Energy Facility Siting Act
358.description: Makes changes to the membership of the energy facilities siting board by increasing the size of the board from three (3) to seven (7) members for certain applications, and also imposes additional requirements on applicants for energy facilities.

359.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
359.title: Biodiesel Heating Oil Act Of 2013
359.description: Mandates minimum levels of biobased product in heating oil.

360.title: Refuse Disposal - Exempting Post-use Polymers, Gasification Processes And Recoverable Feed Stocks
360.description: Exempts recoverable plastics from materials classified as solid waste/provides for converting of recoverable plastics into valuable raw materials.

362.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
362.title: Transportation Network Company Service
362.description: Allows New Shoreham to regulate transportation network company services.

363.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
363.title: New Shoreham Affordable Housing Eligibility
363.description: Increases the percentage of area median income from one hundred twenty percent (120%) one hundred forty percent (140%) only for New Shoreham residents to make more households eligible for affordable housing.

364.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
364.title: The Rhode Island Cesspool Act Of 2007
