364.description: Exempts residential homeowner who has abandoned on-site system from hiring contractor to secure system, as long as homeowner has done so. Necessitates inspection by local sewer authority.

366.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
366.title: Wine Direct Shipper License
366.description: Creates a wine direct shipper license to allow for shipment of limited amounts of wine through the mail to eligible customers.

368.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
368.title: Manufacturing And Wholesale Licenses
368.description: Increases the amount of malt beverages that a manufacturer can sell for offsite consumption from two hundred eighty-eight ounces (288 oz.) to six hundred sixty-six ounces (666 oz.).

369.title: Relating To Insurance
369.description: Allows disability insurance with a benefit limit in excess of a benefit limit available from an admitted insurer to be written in the surplus lines market.

370.title: Casualty Insurance Rating
370.description: Raises amount from $1,500 to $3,000 at which insurer may fail to renew private passenger auto policy/assess premium surcharge for property damage claim payment. Eff. 1/1/20.

371.title: Reciprocity Agreements
371.description: Authorizes the governor and the reciprocity board to enter into motor vehicle and disability parking reciprocity agreements with the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico.

372.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
372.title: Funeral Directors/embalmer Funeral Service Establishments
372.description: Requires funeral directors to intern in RI prior to licensing. Photo IDs for funeral directors. Unlicensed practice punishable as felony. Funeral establishments shall maintain website for obituary.

373.title: Minority Business Enterprise
373.description: Provides that any minority business enterprise certified by the Federal Small Business Act shall be deemed certified by the department of administration as a minority business enterprise.

375.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
375.title: The Consumer Protection In Eye Care Act
375.description: Provides consumer protection in eye care services by developing standards and enforcement protocols related to the utilization of emergent technologies in the provision of eye care services, as well as for the delegation of eye care services by providers.

376.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
376.title: Motorcycle Charity Rides
376.description: Provides that organizers of motorcycle charity rides receive a permit from the department of transportation. Motorcycle charity rides with a police escort may proceed through an intersection despite traffic control devices.

377.title: Construction And Maintenance Of State Roads
377.description: Requires DOT to establish rules and regulations for the use of steel plates on roadway surfaces, and for towns and cities to adopt the same for use on municipal highways.

378.title: State Building Code - Administration And Enforcement
378.description: Requires that all electrical work performed in the state be done in accordance with the latest edition of the National Electrical Code, and would also require that the state building commission adopt the latest edition of the National Electrical Code.

379.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Cars Inc.
379.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Cars Inc.

381.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
381.title: Long-term Contracting Standard For Renewable Energy
381.description: Clarifies that all interconnection and standby transformer costs are to be socialized by National Grid throughout the state of Rhode Island, retroactive to June 15, 2010.

382.title: Definitions And General Code Provisions
382.description: Classifies all vehicles used by the department of corrections in the performance official duties as authorized emergency vehicles.

383.title: Changeable Message Signs
383.description: Regulates the use of electronic changeable highway message signs (CMS) and requires the signs to display traffic operational, regulatory, warning, guidance, accident, and road information.

384.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
384.title: Insurance Rates
384.description: Prevents the consideration of an applicant's credit history in determining automobile liability insurance rates.

386.title: Internet Digital Blocking
386.description: Requires Internet service providers to provide digital blocking of sexual and offensive material.

387.title: Contribution Among Joint Tortfeasors
387.description: Settlement of claim related to Ringling Circus incident shall not discharge other joint tortfeasors.

388.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
388.title: Uniform Directed Trust Act
388.description: Permits the settlor of a trust to designate a trust director who shall be a person other than the trustee to direct actions relative to a trust and pursuant to any power of direction.

389.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
389.title: Procedure Generally -- Litigation Lending Agreements
389.description: Makes litigation loan agreements subject to state usury laws.

390.title: Procedure Generally
390.description: Provides that an open and obvious danger or defect is not a complete bar to recovery of damages in personal injury or property damage actions.

391.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
391.title: Mandatory Use Of Paper Ballots
391.description: Requires that all local, state and federal voting be conducted through the use of paper ballots.

392.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
392.title: General Regulatory Provisions - Internet Privacy And Security
392.description: Establishes that manufacturers of devices capable of connecting to the Internet equip the devices with reasonable security features.

393.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
393.title: Procedure In Particular Actions - Death By Wrongful Act
393.description: Allows damages recovery for emotional stress, grief, loss of enjoyment of life resulting from wrongful death of a spouse, parent, child to all pending future claims.

395.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
395.title: Contested Pet Ownership
395.description: Creates a legal process by which formerly cohabitating parties could seek from the district court a determination as to ownership of any pet.

398.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
398.title: Theft, Embezzlement, False Pretenses And Misappropriations
398.description: Requires that penalties or restitution payments for larceny or campaign expenditure reporting violations be deposited into the general fund.

399.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
399.title: Rhode Island Uniform Real Property Transfer On Death Act
399.description: Allows an owner or owners of real property to execute a deed that names one or more beneficiaries who will obtain title to the property at the owner's death without the necessity of probate.

400.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
400.title: Hotels
400.description: Authorizes an innkeeper to remove any guest who is a level III high risk to reoffend sexual offender who attempts to remain a hotel resident for more than thirty (30) consecutive days in any calendar year.

402.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
402.title: Special Police For Private Institutions
402.description: Clarifies the jurisdiction of special police officers upon the land and buildings of educational institutions, and on roads adjacent to the educational institutions to instances where the officer notices that a person is in danger of bodily harm.

403.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
403.title: Correctional Institutions
403.description: Repeals the provision of the general laws declaring prisoners serving a life sentence civilly dead.

404.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
404.title: Sexual Offender Registration And Community Notification
404.description: Provides that only those juveniles over the age of fourteen (14) be required to register as sex offenders, and only if the offense is comparable or more severe than those defined in 18 U.S.C. § 2241(aggravated sexual abuse).

405.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
405.title: Code Of Ethics
405.description: Eliminates exceptions to the "revolving-door rule" and for persons holding senior policy making/discretionary/confidential staff positions with 5 years of uninterrupted state service.

406.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
406.title: Relating To State Affairs And Government-open Meetings
406.description: Requires the attorney general to respond to open meetings violation complaints within twenty (20) days of receiving the complaint.

407.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
407.title: Rhode Island Campaign Contributions And Expenditures Reporting
407.description: Requires nonprofit entities and candidates comply with reporting requirements for transportation and other amenities provided to any candidate, prohibits nonprofit owned by candidate from providing any amenity to any other candidate.

409.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
409.title: Relating To Criminal Procedure-identification And Apprehension Of Criminals
409.description: Permits the expungement of criminal records for any crime that has, subsequent to the conviction or plea of nolo contendere, has been repealed.

410.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
410.title: Procedure In Particular Actions - Social Media Censorship Protection Act
410.description: Prohibits certain social media companies from censoring users speech by either removal of the user's speech or using algorithms to prevent the user's speech.

414.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
414.title: Confidentiality Of Health Care Communications And Information Act
414.description: Amends the definition of a deceased patient/client's authorized representative from his or her heirs-at-law to any heir-at-law.

415.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
415.title: Public Use Of Private Lands-liability Limitations
415.description: Changes the definition of owner to exclude the state and municipalities for the purposes of liability limitations relating to public use of private lands.

416.title: Traffic Control Devices
416.description: Codifies the lawful procedure for a bicyclist to follow when complying with traffic control signals.

417.title: State Lottery
417.description: Requires lottery director to setoff lottery prize exceeding $600 against back child support (1st priority)/labor benefit overpayments (2nd priority)/back taxes (3rd priority)/non-tax state debts (4th priority) before prize payment.

418.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
418.title: Assaults
418.description: Makes it a felony to commit an assault on a person with developmental disabilities.

419.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
419.title: Courts -- Judicial Nominating Commission
419.description: Promotes more diversity in the composition of the judicial nominating commission and would require that each list of qualified judicial candidates it submits to the governor for nomination include a person of color.

420.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
420.title: Operators' License - Safe Roads And Mandatory Insurance
420.description: Allows DMV to issue driving privilege licenses/permits to applicants unable to establish lawful presence in US which are not valid for ID purposes effective July 1, 2019.

421.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
421.title: Judicial Nominating Commission
421.description: Requires that the judicial nominating commission be composed of at least three (3) members of color.

422.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
422.title: Residence Of Those In Government Custody Act
422.description: Requires that the state use the actual residences of persons in government custody for census and redistricting purposes.

424.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
424.title: Indictments, Informations And Complaints
424.description: Eliminates the statute of limitations for second-degree and third-degree sexual assault.

427.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
427.title: Rhode Island Values Act--enhanced Community Protection In Immigration Enforcement Action
427.description: Enhances community protection during federal immigration enforcement and investigatory actions, identifying certain community locations as "sensitive locations" requiring those locations receive a warrant before granting access to enforcement agents.

429.title: Mayoral Academies
429.description: Requires any mayoral academy which is part of a network that seeks to be established or expanded to provide evidence that its attrition rates, special education rates and suspension rates are within acceptable averages.

430.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
430.title: Small Loan Lenders
430.description: Repeals the provisions of the general laws allowing deferred deposit providers, also known as "payday lenders."

431.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
431.title: Independent Charter Schools
431.description: Provides that the office of auditor general be responsible for analyzing and reporting the impact of new or expanded charter schools.

432.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
432.title: Sugary Drinks
432.description: Creates a tax on sugary drinks and creates a dedicated revenue source for programs designed to benefit public health.

433.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
433.title: The Education Equality And Property Tax Relief Act
433.description: Furnishes financial support for planning/implementation of effective community schools that would provide students with equitable access to high-quality education.

434.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
434.title: Refuse Disposal
434.description: Provides that effective July 1, 2019, a municipality not in compliance with the state's recycling and diversion rates for solid waste may enter into an agreement with the Resource Recovery Corporation to attain those rates.

436.title: The Good Samaritan Overdose Prevention Act Of 2016
436.description: Provides that law enforcement personnel, emergency medical personnel, and agencies participating in the HOPE initiative be exempt from civil liability or criminal prosecution as a result of administering opioid antagonists.

439.last_action: Committee recommends passage of Sub A in concurrence
439.title: Department Of Health - Clinical Trials Website
439.description: Requires the state department of health to post and maintain on its website a link to ClinicalTrials.gov, a free service of the National Institutes of Health Library of Medicine.

441.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
441.title: Kratom Consumer Protection Act
441.description: Regulates the distribution of food products containing the drug kratom, a drug of concern for its stimulant and sedative effects, to consumers by the department of health. Effective September 1, 2019.

442.title: Office Of State Medical Examiners
442.description: Adds the multi-disciplinary maternal mortality review committee to the review of the office of state medical examiners and extend certain immunities and confidentiality agreements to multi-disciplinary teams.

444.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
444.title: Harm Reduction Center Advisory Committee And Pilot Program
444.description: Authorizes the establishment of harm reduction centers.

445.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
445.title: Rights And Duties Of Teachers Generally
445.description: Requires that teachers be trained and certified in cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR).

446.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
446.title: Civic Literacy
446.description: Requires the commissioner of elementary and secondary education to adopt a course of study on the nation's founding and related documents, including the Declaration of Independence, the United States Constitution, and the Federalist Papers.

449.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
449.title: Naloxone Public Access Program
449.description: Requires public places to have naloboxes or naloxone on the premises for access and use during emergencies by trained employees or the general public with "Good Samaritan" protections.

451.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
451.title: Relating To Health And Safety- Lila Manfield Sapinsley Compassionate Care Act
451.description: Creates the Lila Manfield Sapinsley Compassionate Care Act, to provide a legal mechanism whereby a terminally ill patient may choose to end their life using drugs prescribed by a physician.

453.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
453.title: Determination Of Need For New Health-care Equipment
453.description: Exempts both single/multiple entity physician-owned ambulatory surgical centers from CON requirements treating them as a physicians' practice extension governed by DOH.

455.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
455.title: Health And Safety Of Students
455.description: Requires the RIDE, within the next three years, to create a plan where all RI teachers would be trained in the BEARS curriculum (BEARS training includes hands-only cardiopulmonary resuscitation, Heimlich maneuver, and bleeding control).

456.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
456.title: School And Youth Programs Concussion Act
456.description: Requires all school districts to designate an athletic trainer to be available for high school athletic practices and games.

457.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
457.title: Training Of Elected Officials In The Event Of Disaster Emergencies
457.description: Requires state and municipal elected officials to attend a one-day biennial training seminar in emergency management for disaster emergencies.

458.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
458.title: Preservation Of Families With Disabled Parent Act
458.description: Precludes the disability of a parent from serving as a basis for denial or restriction in matters involving a child's welfare, foster care, family law, guardianship and adoption.

459.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
459.title: Suicide Prevention - The Nathan Bruno And Jason Flatt Act
459.description: Creates the "Nathan Bruno and Jason Flatt Act" which requires training of teachers and school personnel regarding suicide awareness and prevention and establishment of a conflict resolution process between teachers or school personnel and students.

460.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
460.title: Pfas In Food Packaging
460.description: Prohibits PFAS, a class of fluorinated organic chemicals, from being used in food packaging.

461.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
461.title: Home Community Care Services To The Elderly
461.description: Expands eligibility for elderly services assistance to persons under age 65 suffering from physician confirmed Alzheimer's disease related dementia with income not to exceed 250% of federal poverty level.

462.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
462.title: The Breast Cancer Act
462.description: Amends the current law so that digital breast tomosynthesis (dbt) screenings are available wherever mammograms are conducted and to provide insurance coverage for such screenings.

464.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
464.title: The Healing Art Of Acupuncture And Oriental Medicine - New Title
464.description: Changes title of chapter 5-37.2 and replaces the word "Oriental" with "Chinese" and allows qualified and certified individuals to practice acupuncture and Chinese medicine using accepted medical diagnostic methods.

465.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
465.title: Rhode Island Pathways Project
465.description: Requires the executive office of health and human services (EOHHS) to conduct a study to assess the impact of using Medicaid funds to provide coverage for the treatment of the chronically homeless.

466.title: Physician Assistants
466.description: Updates the laws relating to physician assistants to reflect current standards and terminology.

467.title: Abuse In Health Care Facilities
467.description: Makes amendments providing for additional reporting duties and requirements for persons with knowledge of mistreatment or neglect of elders.

468.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
468.title: Paul W. Crowley Student Investment Initiative
468.description: Restructures professional development investment fund to assume duties of dissemination of curriculum materials/frameworks/assessments/development plans with annual allocation of $200 per student.

469.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
469.title: Quality Self-directed Services - Individual Companions Of Companionship And Homemaking Services
469.description: Revises law protecting beneficiaries from fraud, waste, abuse, neglect and provides state oversight when long-term services and beneficiaries use an individual companion for delivery of Medicaid services.

472.title: Procedure Generally - Fees
472.description: Provides for a fee increase for filing an action in district court, superior court and family court.

474.title: Licensing Of Health Care Facilities
474.description: Mandates no new initial licenses for nursing facilities to be issued prior to July 1, 2022. Prior to July 1, 2022, licensing agency not allowed to increase licensed bed capacity.

475.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
475.title: Sale And Use Taxes -- Liability And Computation
475.description: Imposes 1% state tax on sale of hookah tobacco/vaping devices, accessories/supplies/replacement parts & 1% local hookah tobacco/vaping devices tax to be used by cities/towns for education of persons of the dangers of hookah tobacco/vaping device usage.

476.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
476.title: Oversight Of Risk-bearing Provider Organizations
476.description: Provides the office of the health insurance commissioner with oversight of risk-bearing provider organizations and health care risk contracts.

477.title: Tax Sales
477.description: Exempts RIMHFC-acquired tax lien property from nonutilization tax/allows RIMHFC to foreclose after 1 yr if mortgage foreclosed/property abandoned/replaces 2 members of defunct organizations with existing organization members on advisory board.

478.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
478.title: School Building Authority
478.description: Provides for school construction projects approved after July 1, 2019, that Rhode Island based architectural businesses be used or the project is only eligible to receive five (5) incentive points.

479.title: Coastal Resources Management Council
479.description: Provides funding to Rhode Island department of environmental management, office of energy resources and to coastal resource management council from any offshore land lease fees associated with offshore wind systems that access state waters.

480.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
480.title: State Funds
480.description: Adds the Judiciary's Indirect Cost Recovery – Supreme Court, Victims' Rights Information, RI Supreme Court Disciplinary Counsel and Small Claims Mediation accounts to the list of restricted receipt accounts which are not subject to indirect cost recovery.

482.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
482.title: Automated School-zone-speed-enforcement System Act Of 2016
482.description: Requires the cities and towns to place funds generated from automated school-zone-speed-enforcement systems in a state operated restricted receipt account for school safety programs.

483.title: State Investment Commission
483.description: Requires investment commission to include separate section in annual report providing information and supporting documents relating to alternative investment consultant(s), hiring, performance, and confidentiality agreements.

484.title: Sales And Use Taxes-enforcement And Collection
484.description: Enacts two 10 year statute of limitations on two separate tax functions.

485.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
485.title: Personal Income Tax -- Deduction For Maintaining Residence
485.description: Permits persons over the age of sixty-five (65) to deduct from their adjusted gross income the cost of maintaining a personal residence, up to seven thousand five hundred dollars ($7,500).

486.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
486.title: Registration Plates
486.description: Permits the motor vehicle administration to allow auctions of registration plates for charity.

488.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
488.title: Rhode Island Uniform Securities Act
488.description: Exempts a developer or seller of an open blockchain token from the provisions of the Rhode Island Uniform Securities Act. A blockchain is a tool utilized in digital currency.

490.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
490.title: Personal Income Tax -- Part 44-30-81 Procedure And Administration
490.description: Provides, for the tax year 2018 and thereafter, that any tax overpayment would be refunded with interest calculated at twelve percent (12%) compounded daily if not received by the thirtieth day of June in the subsequent year.

491.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
491.title: Rhode Island Uniform Securities Act - Virtual Currency
491.description: Exempts transactions involving virtual currency from the Rhode Island Uniform Securities Act.

492.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
492.title: The Life Appropriations Act
492.description: Creates the life appropriations act prohibiting public dollars from the state of Rhode Island to be awarded to any entity that performs convenience abortions.

493.title: Preservation Of Agricultural Land
493.description: Assigns to the division of agriculture within (DEM) the responsibility of administering all bond referenda approved funding for preservation of farm or agricultural land.

494.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
494.title: The Education Equity And Property Tax Relief Act -- School Funding Formula
494.description: Freezes the amount of education aid for local school agencies that are scheduled to receive less aid under the funding formula. The education aid would be frozen at the rate provided in fiscal year 2019 for a period of three (3) years.

496.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
496.title: Tobacco And Nicotine Products--children
496.description: Provides certain restrictions on the sale of tobacco products, enhance the definition of "tobacco products", and would raise the minimum age to purchase tobacco products and nicotine delivery systems from 18 to 21 years of age

497.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor (05/14/2019)
497.title: Health Care For Elderly And Disabled
497.description: Increases the income eligibility limit for medical assistance coverage for seniors and disabled individuals from one hundred percent (100%) to one hundred thirty-three percent (133%) of federal poverty level.

499.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
499.title: Compliance Of Public Employees With State Income Tax
499.description: Eliminates requirement that political subdivisions provide list of employees as of July 1 of preceding year to take administrator by August 1 of each year.

501.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
501.title: Medical Assistance--perinatal Doula Services
501.description: Provides for medical assistance health care for expectant mothers and establishes medical assistance coverage and reimbursement rates for perinatal doula services.

503.title: Comprehensive Health Insurance Program
503.description: Establishes a universal, comprehensive, affordable single-payer health care insurance program.

504.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
504.title: Department Of Attorney General
504.description: Increases from 10% to 25% amount attorney general receives from multi-state initiative settlements/eliminates $65,000 cap and spending restrictions.

506.title: Electronic Payment Of Sales Taxes
506.description: Requires that the tax administrator credit electronic sales and use tax payments made electronically exactly when received.

507.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
507.title: Division Of Developmental Disabilities
507.description: Provides for authorizations for services to developmentally disabled adults issued on or after July 1, 2019, be developed on an annual basis with funding for these services to be issued on an annual basis.

508.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
508.title: The Rhode Island Works Program
508.description: Amends the definition of "dependent child" and allows an additional year of vocational education upon successful completion of the first year of education at CCRI.

510.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
510.title: Low- And Moderate-income Housing
510.description: Provides for increases in the amount of foundation level school support that a community would receive, based upon a community's ability to meet and surpass its minimum low and moderate income housing requirements.

512.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
512.title: Medical Assistance - Long-term Care Service And Finance Reform
512.description: Provides for a Medicaid home nursing care and hospice base rate adjustment for services delivered by highly skilled nursing professionals to high-acuity or high medical necessity Medicaid beneficiaries that have tracheostomies or use ventilators.

513.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
513.title: Sales And Use Taxes
513.description: Provides for a use tax exemption for all health care facilities licensed by the department of health that are required by a federal or state government entity to purchase, store, use, or otherwise consume prewritten computer software.

515.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
515.title: Deferred Compensation Plans
515.description: Allows state employees the ability to make an after tax contribution to a qualified Roth contribution program as a part of a deferred compensation plan.

519.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
519.title: The Climate Change Coastal Adaptation Trust Fund
519.description: Establishes OSACR, a fund which provides grants to fund projects that adapt infrastructure to address climate change; assess eligibility of projects, allocation, disbursements and the fund's financing. Effective July 1, 2019.

520.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
520.title: Relating To Public Finance
520.description: Provides additional controls on state spending by enhancing reporting requirements and penalties and restricting over expenditures.

521.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
521.title: Manufacturing And Economic Development--tax Incentives
521.description: Establishes the "refundable investment tax credit act" to provide for a refundable investment tax credit for certain investments in the construction of facilities, acquisition of tangible property, and the training of employees in the state.

522.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
522.title: State Fleet Replacement Revolving Loan Fund
522.description: Requires the state to phase in the use of zero emission vehicles beginning in 2020 using state fleet replacement revolving loan funds.

525.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
525.title: Education Assistance And Development Tax Credit
525.description: Creates a tax credit for the amount in excess of ten thousand dollars ($10,000) contributed to a public school district for the express purpose of making physical improvements to a school.

526.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
526.title: Estate And Transfer Taxes - Liability And Computation
526.description: Establishes portability of unused estate tax credit of predeceasing spouse by surviving spouse for decedents dying after 12/31/18.

527.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
527.title: Lean Government Initiative Act
527.description: Would, through the office of management and budget, implement the Lean government initiative and include a mandatory yearly progress report by departments, agencies, boards and commissions.

528.title: Contractors' Bonds
528.description: Requires road and bridge contractors for the department of transportation to furnish a bond equal to at least 50% of the contract price on contracts in excess of one hundred and fifty thousand dollars ($150,000).

529.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
529.title: Prompt Payment By Department Of Administration
529.description: Amends the provisions for prompt payment of monies owed by the department of administration to their contractors or subcontractors.

530.title: Rhode Island Resource Recovery Corporation
530.description: Provides that any solid waste collected and disposed of by, or on behalf of the district, shall be charged the same tipping fee per ton as the municipal rate and require the waste hauler to certify the tonnage at the time of disposal.

531.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
531.title: Subdivision Of Land
531.description: Amends definitions for minor land development and minor subdivision, reduces time periods for minor and major applications, requires public meeting/hearing for waiver/modification to plan, and changes decision time periods.

532.title: Rhode Island Housing And Mortgage Finance Corporation
532.description: Includes in the definition of affordable housing houses whose assessed value meets the criteria of affordable housing even if such houses are not for sale. In addition, proposed housing developments which meet the criteria would be included.

533.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
533.title: Explosives - Notice
533.description: Expands the notice requirements relating to the use of explosives by requiring two (2) weeks' notice of blasting to the municipality and to owners of structures within five hundred feet (500') of the mutual property line.

534.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
534.title: Licenses Generally
534.description: Requires that notice of application to owners of property within two hundred feet (200') of the site of a proposed liquor licensee be given by certified mail.

535.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
535.title: Low And Moderate Income Housing
535.description: Allows a local review board of a city or town to provide reasonable conditions and limitations on any low and moderate income housing project.

538.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
538.title: Miscellaneous Rules
538.description: Prohibits any city or town employee, including private contractors, removing trash from leaving trash receptacles so as to constitute a hazard on the highways.

539.title: Regulation Of Sales
539.description: Allows license holders to restrict any person who has not reached his or her twenty first birthday from entering the licensed establishment after ten o'clock (10:00) pm.

540.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
540.title: Atlantic Time Zone
540.description: Provides for Rhode Island's adoption of the Atlantic Time Zone if and when Massachusetts does so.

541.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
541.title: Trafficking Of Persons And Involuntary Servitude
541.description: Provides specific language for signs to be posted at certain establishments notifying people of contact information to the national human trafficking resource center.

542.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
542.title: Nontransparent Windshields And Windows
542.description: Provides an exemption, for private detectives and private security guards, from the law banning nontransparent windshields and windows.

543.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
543.title: Public Buildings
543.description: Authorizes the painting of a portrait of the president of the senate to be hung in the state house.

544.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
544.title: State Police
544.description: Prohibits more than two (2) members of the state police to be from the same family whether by blood, adoption or marriage.

545.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
545.title: State Police - Diversity
545.description: Beginning June 30, 2019, requires 1 in 5 recruits to the Rhode Island State Police Training Academy be a person of color and also requires vigorous recruitment effort.

546.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
546.title: State Police -- Equal Employment Opportunity
546.description: Establishes an equal opportunity unit within the division of state police to adopt an equal opportunity plan to increase the ranks of minorities and women among members of the state police.

547.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
547.title: Rhode Island Secure Choice Retirement Savings Program Act
547.description: Creates voluntary retirement IRA savings program for workers requiring employers to make available to employees if no employer retirement plan offered.

548.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
548.title: Workers' Compensation Benefits
548.description: Shifts the legal burden of proof in certain workers' compensation actions involving intoxicating substances.

551.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
551.title: Minimum Wage--gratuities
551.description: Raises the minimum wage for tipped workers by fifty cents ($.50) per year commencing on January 1, 2020 until the tipped minimum wage is not less than two-thirds (2/3) of the regular minimum wage.

552.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
552.title: Tip Protection
552.description: Prohibits employers from receiving any portion of the tips given by customers to their tipped employees, with limited exceptions for credit card service charges.

556.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
556.title: The Energy And Consumer Savings Act Of 2005
556.description: Establishes minimum energy and water efficiency standards for certain products sold or installed in the state.

558.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
558.title: School Waste Recycling And Refuse Disposal
558.description: Requires schools to comply with recycling and composting laws and promotes food donation and local food service contracts.

559.last_action: Committee recommends passage of Sub A
559.title: Plastic Waste Reduction Act
559.description: Creates the "Plastic Waste Reduction Act" to reduce the use of plastic bags, offer recyclable bags and provides penalties for violations. Effective one year from promulgation or January 1, 2021, whichever occurs first.

560.title: The Permanent Air Quality Monitoring Act
560.description: Extends the required air quality monitoring program at T.F. Green International Airport for two years to July 31, 2021.

561.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
561.title: Service Member Licensure
561.description: Provides for service member business license reciprocity for applicant's who have recently established residence in Rhode Island.

562.title: Service Contracts
562.description: Defines service contracts and clarifies that service contracts are not insurance and not otherwise subject to the insurance code.

563.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
563.title: Unemployment Benefits And Domestic Abuse
563.description: Expedites a victim of domestic abuse eligibility for and receipt of unemployment benefits by removing the waiting period and other impediments.

564.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
564.title: Missing Titles For Older Vehicles
564.description: Allows the owner of motor vehicles, which is between ten (10) and twenty (20) years old and cannot locate a title certificate obtain a registration certificate with the name of the current registered owner(s).

565.title: Barbers, Hairdressers, Cosmeticians, Manicurists And Estheticians
565.description: Exempts natural hair braiders from the requirement to be licensed as hairdressers or cosmeticians, and would define the practice of natural hair braiding.

566.title: Public Utilities Commission
566.description: Prohibits nonregulated power producers from automatically renewing a contract. Mandates that the nonregulated power producer provide methods for the customer to cancel service and provide the customer with notice of the contract expiration date.

567.title: Engineers
567.description: Requires that plans for natural gas infrastructure be built to a set of design standards approved by a certified engineer if the work poses a material public safety risk.

568.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
568.title: Relating To Businesses And Professions-barbers, Hairdressers, Cosmeticians, Manicurists And Estheticians
568.description: Enacts a new all-encompassing registration and regulation procedure relating to barbers, hairdressers, cosmeticians, manicurists and estheticians.

570.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
570.title: The Rhode Island Limited-liability Company Act
570.description: Permits a member or members of a limited-liability company to avoid dissolution by buying the membership interest owned by the other member or members seeking dissolution.

571.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
571.title: Relating To Corporations-electronic Networks And Databases
571.description: Enables the use of electronic networks and databases for corporate records.

572.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
572.title: Rhode Island Turnpike And Bridge Authority
572.description: Limits the use of toll collection facilities to toll collection only and not for issuing any other motor vehicle violation.

573.title: Duties Of Utilities And Carriers - Human Trafficking And Child Exploitation Prevention
573.description: Duties Of Utilities And Carriers - Human Trafficking And Child Exploitation Prevention

574.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
574.title: Check Cashing
574.description: Raises the maximum check cashing fee from fifty cents ($.50) to six dollars ($6.00) per check, for persons cashing checks incidental to the retail sale of goods or services.

575.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
575.title: Insurer Receivership Model Act
575.description: Establishes a process for insurers who wish to utilize receivership rather than the other processes of liquidation or rehabilitation.

577.title: General Regulatory Provisions - Purchase And Sale Of Precious Metals
577.description: Requires a licensed buyer of precious metals or articles, tools, and electronics to take a digital photograph of purchase and upload it to the attorney general's license sales tracking system database, maintained for a period of 3 years.

579.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
579.title: Excavation Near Underground Utility Facilities
579.description: Requires any public utility or its contractor to reimburse an excavator for lost time expense incurred, including manpower and equipment from the utilities incorrect marking of underground utilities.

582.title: The Hospital Conversions Act
582.description: Extends monitoring of hospital conversions from 3 to 5 years/increases fine for violations from $1,000,000 to $2,000,000/simplifies judicial review.

583.last_action: House voted to recommit to House Judiciary
583.title: Local Planning Board Or Commission--zoning Ordinances
583.description: Provides that a quorum of the zoning board of review shall be a majority of members authorized to vote which may include alternate members.

585.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
585.title: Administrative Procedures
585.description: Provides that the state board of elections would be exempt from the "administrative procedures act" except for certain rule-making provisions of the "administrative procedures act".

586.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
586.title: Procedure Generally - Governmental Tort Liability
586.description: Removes the exception to the ($100,000.00) limitation of damages when the state is engaged in a proprietary function in the commission of a tort, and would exempt the state and any city or town or fire district from interest awards in civil actions.

587.title: Registration Of Voters
587.description: Allows voters to file state form designating party affiliation rather than in person and change affiliation within 30 days prior to primary election with local canvassing board.

594.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
594.title: Rhode Island Parentage Act
594.description: Repeals current state law regarding paternity and replaces it with a more comprehensive parentage act that provides procedures establishing parentage, genetic testing, surrogacy agreements and assisted reproduction.

595.title: Relating To Courts And Civil Procedure--procedure Generally
595.description: Adopts the uniform interstate depositions and discovery act, and amends the current law regarding depositions taken for use in a foreign jurisdiction by referencing the new act.

596.title: Nomination Of Party And Independent Candidates
596.description: Amends several election statutes to require votes received by declared write-in candidates to be reported, requires a declaration to be filed by candidates to be elected by write-in and considers ballots cast for no office to be "irregular ballots".

597.title: Children
597.description: Makes the practice of aiding a minor in the process of getting an abortion a civil and criminal offense.

598.title: Uniform Controlled Substances Act - Offenses And Penalties
598.description: Decreases the penalties for unlawful possession of a schedule I, II, III, IV, and V controlled substance from imprisonment for 3 years down to 1 year and a maximum fine of ($5,000) reduced to a maximum fine of five hundred dollars ($500).

599.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
599.title: Mail Ballots
599.description: Permits emergency mail ballots at any time prior to any election and would require that electors sign an electronic poll book containing a certificate of facts relating to the circumstances necessitating the emergency application.

602.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
602.title: Voter Registration
602.description: Removes the requirement that party primary voters automatically change their party affiliation to that party and reduces from 90 to 30 days the time before an election that a non-candidate can change their affiliation.

603.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
603.title: Courts - Public Records
603.description: Classifies the names, applications and resumes submitted to the judicial nominating commission as public records.

604.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
604.title: Courts - Family Court
604.description: Expands jurisdiction of family court related to custody or guardianship of immigrant children to include immigrant persons between 18 years and 21 years of age for purposes of abuse and neglect determinations in accordance with federal law.

605.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
605.title: Pen Registers And Trap And Trace Devices
605.description: Prohibits the use of a stingray cell-site simulator device by any law enforcement agency except upon application for its use and the granting of its order by the presiding justice of the superior court.

606.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
606.title: Search Warrants
606.description: Requires the sealing of an application for a search warrant unless the court issuing the warrant issues an order granting relief from the seal.

607.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
607.title: Asset Forfeiture
607.description: Creates a new chapter to standardize procedures for asset forfeitures for all crimes.

609.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
609.title: Access To Public Records--cost
609.description: Provides that fees for costs charged for search, retrieval or copying of public records shall be waived for members of the general assembly who certify that they are acting in their official capacity.

610.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
610.title: Courts
610.description: Vests with the governor the sole authority to nominate, on the basis of merit, from a list submitted by the judicial nominating commission with the advice and consent of the senate, all judges and magistrates, to all courts.

612.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
612.title: Presidential Candidates
612.description: Requires all candidates for United States President and Vice President file copies of their last 5 years of federal income tax returns with the state board of elections no later than 50 days prior to the general election.

615.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
615.title: Real Estate Sales Disclosures
615.description: Requires real estate sellers to provide buyers with an annual building energy cost estimate and imposes a duty on sellers to conduct real estate condition inspections.

617.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
617.title: Primaries
617.description: Requires that on all primaries, the candidate's names would be listed in an order chosen by lot under the direction of the secretary of state.

620.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
620.title: Judicial Selection
620.description: Requires the judicial nominating commission to consider a nominee's unique background and overall competence in all areas of practice of laws rather than emphasizing trial and courtroom experience in selecting nominees for the judiciary.

622.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
622.title: Children With Disabilities [see Title 16 Chapter 97 - The Rhode Island Board Of Education Act]
622.description: Requires the installation of video surveillance cameras and equipment in any classroom which has an enrolled child with a disability, who as a result of such disability is unable to communicate.

624.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
624.title: Large Capacity Feeding Device Ban
624.description: Prohibits sale/possession of feeding device holding more then 10 ammunition rounds punishable by up to $5,000 fine or up to 5 years imprisonment with law enforcement/military personnel exceptions.

627.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
627.title: Grand Juries
627.description: Permits grand juries to issue reports to superior court as a public record and provide a process for review and acceptance by the superior court and allow the attorney general or any person or entity named in the report to challenge the court's decision.

628.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
628.title: Relating To Courts And Civil Procedure--courts
628.description: Provides that the chief justice of the supreme court may declare a disaster emergency and orders necessary action to ensure efficient operation of the judicial system.

629.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
629.title: Law Practice
629.description: Provides that the rules and regulations pertaining to the unauthorized practice of law committee would be approved and promulgated by the supreme court.

630.title: Courts - Domestic Assault
630.description: Updates the language required to be given by police officers when responding to domestic abuse calls.

631.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
631.title: Use Of Lanes
631.description: Makes using the passing lane on limited access highways a violation when not passing another vehicle.

633.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
633.title: Relating To Criminal Offenses-disorderly Conduct
633.description: Makes threats of mass violence to any educational or religious institution, social, civic or fraternal association a felony and allows the court to set reasonable conditions of release of the defendant in order to assure the safety of the community.

635.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
635.title: Theft, Embezzlement, False Pretenses, And Misappropriation
635.description: Amends certain campaign contribution and expenditure reporting requirements and would provide for forfeiture of campaign contributions upon a conviction or plea of nolo contendere to specified felony crimes relating to public office.

640.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
640.title: Condominium Law -- Management Contracts
640.description: Requires condo unit owners' association officers to verify management agents/companies retained by association are insured regarding services provided.

641.title: Casino Gaming
641.description: Prohibit minors under the age of twenty-one (21) years old from engaging in any type of legal casino gambling and be subject to civil penalties for violation.

643.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
643.title: Related To Food And Drugs - The Edward O. Hawkins And Thomas C. Slater Medical Marijuana Act
643.description: Prohibits employer discrimination against medical marijuana cardholders testing positive, allows for civil remedies for medical marijuana cardholders experiencing discrimination, provides state as sole regulator for compassion centers/medical marijuana.

648.title: Nomination - Declaration Of Candidacy - Primary Votes
648.description: Moves the date of primaries to the eighth Tuesday preceding biennial state elections.

649.title: Elective Meetings
649.description: Mandates that polls in all cities and towns except New Shoreham open at 7 am and provides time for receipt of ballots cast outside the US.

652.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
652.title: Trade In Covered Animal Parts Or Products
652.description: Prohibits the purchase, sale, offer for sale or possession with intent to sell covered animal parts or products and provide for penalties for violation ranging from misdemeanor to felony upon conviction.

653.title: Local Ownership Opportunity Act
653.description: Creates a process that provides affected employees an opportunity to purchase the business that employs them, but is in danger of being sold or going out of business.

655.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Amaral & Associates Real Estate, Inc.
655.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Amaral & Associates Real Estate, Inc.

656.title: Real Estate Appraisers Certification Act
656.description: Precludes the department of business regulation from pursing any administrative action against a certified appraiser more than five (5) years after the certified appraised issues a certified appraisal.

658.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
658.title: Net Metering
658.description: Add a definition for "industrial and commercial" to be included in the net metering chapter of the general laws.

659.title: Department Of Business Regulation - Virtual Currency
659.description: Establishes "Digital Asset Business Act". Regulates virtual-currency. Exempts virtual-currency from securities requirements and taxation.

661.title: Revised Uniform Fiduciary Access To Digital Assets Act
661.description: Regulates fiduciary and designated recipient access to digital assets relating to probate practice and procedure by creating the "Revised Uniform Fiduciary Access to Digital Assets Act" to promote uniformity of the law among states that enact it.

662.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
662.title: Licenses And Registrations
662.description: Requires the payment of all outstanding city or town taxes, fees and fines due and payable prior to renewal of a driver's license or vehicle registration.

663.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
663.title: The Percentage Of Income Home Energy Affordability Act
663.description: Creates the Percentage of Income Home Energy Affordability Program, an income-sensitive tiered subsidy program to ensure that home energy utility costs are affordable for eligible low-income households.

664.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
664.title: General Powers
664.description: Allows municipalities to reasonably restrict access to public areas for safety and security reasons.

665.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
665.title: Relating To Property
665.description: Provides that in the town of Cumberland, the maximum height allowed for a commercial or residential condominium complex be no more than 35 feet.

666.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
666.title: Health And Education Of Pupils
666.description: Provides for a statewide real time threat notification system for schools administered by the department of public safety.

668.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
668.title: Sanitation In Food Establishments
668.description: Adds pickles and relish to those foods which are permitted to be manufactured and sold as a farm home food product.

670.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
670.title: Children -- Confinement In Motor Vehicles Prohibited
670.description: Repeals the requirement that law enforcement officers issue only warnings of the risks to persons leaving a child under the age of seven (7) unattended in a motor vehicle.

672.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
672.title: Rhode Island Energy Resources Act
672.description: Provides for the establishment of comprehensive solar energy siting ordinances in each municipality of the state.

673.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
673.title: Rhode Island Veterans' Home
673.description: Amends the composition of the council for veterans' affairs by replacing members of the general assembly with veterans-at-large.

674.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
674.title: Department Of Environmental Management
674.description: Provides that all beach parking fees remain at the current rate for the next three (3) beach seasons.

676.last_action: Referred to Senate Environment and Agriculture
676.title: Proper Management Of Unused Paint
676.description: Requires that the department of environmental management to request proposals, every two years, to solicit procurement of a representative organization to operate the paint stewardship program.

677.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
677.title: Relating To Food And Drugs-the Rhode Island Cannabis Equity Act Of 2019
677.description: Establishes a board and appropriates funds from the legislature to create a local cannabis equity program to allow those people who want to enter the business of selling marijuana with state funding and technical assistance to do so.

678.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
678.title: Relating To Central Falls
678.description: Relieves Central Falls from reimbursing state for expenses related to fiscal stability act, expenses related to Central Falls school district bankruptcy proceeding, expenses of Moreau v Flanders, or expenses incurred after termination of receivership.

680.title: Relating To Coventry Sewer Authority
680.description: Prohibits the town of Coventry from charging its sewage works' users interest charges of no more than five-tenths of one percent (.5%).

681.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
681.title: Department Of Business Regulation--automobile Wrecking And Salvage Yards
681.description: Prohibits any entity or individual from advertising the sale, purchase, receipt, transport, delivery or salvage of any junk or discarded automobile unless the advertiser is a licensed auto wrecking or salvage yard.

684.title: Accident And Sickness Insurance Policies - Step Therapy Protocol
684.description: Creates a thirteen (13) member commission to review and recommend guidelines for step therapy protocols, and who would report back to the House by March 7, 2020, and would expire on May 7, 2020.

685.title: Pawtucket/central Falls Opportunity Zone Income Tax Credit Act
685.description: Provides tax credits for qualified investments in "opportunity zones" in Pawtucket and Central Falls.

686.title: Preservation Of Families With Disabled Parent
686.description: Precludes the disability of a parent from serving as a basis for denial or restriction in matters involving a child's welfare, foster care, family law, guardianship and adoption without written findings by the family court.

687.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
687.title: Unfair Sales Practices - Gift Certificates
687.description: Requires issuers of gift certificates to deposit and hold funds used to purchase the gift certificate in escrow for three (3) years, or until the gift certificate is redeemed and would restrict certain redemption terms in the event of bankruptcy.

688.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
688.title: Woodland Preservation And Stewardship Act
688.description: Establishes and implements woodland stewardship and preservation programs managed by the department of environmental management administered by cities and towns through local comprehensive planning and zoning.

689.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
689.title: Payment To Health Care Providers
689.description: Allows health care providers to refuse to accept payment by virtual credit card payment (a single-use digital credit card) at least once each health insurance contract year.

691.title: Prevention And Suppression Of Contagious Diseases - Hiv/aids
691.description: Permits clinical laboratories as defined in § 23-16.2-2(2) to conduct its own analysis of specimens for the detection of HIV/AIDS instead of sending the specimens to the department of health.

692.title: Sexual Assaults
692.description: Provides that a school teacher or employee that engages in sexual penetration of a student over fourteen (14) and less than eighteen (18) shall be guilty of third degree sexual assault.

694.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
694.title: Teachers Retirement [see Title 16 Chapter 97-the Rhode Island Board Of Education Act]
694.description: Provides for an increasing stipend to be paid to certain retired state employees, municipal employees, and teachers or their beneficiaries during years when a cost of living adjustment is not scheduled.

695.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
695.title: Divorce And Separation
695.description: Creates a custody procedure for pets in divorce and separation proceedings based on the best interests of the animal.

696.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
696.title: Procedure In Particular Actions -- Attachment
696.description: Provides that child support garnishment be paid first before any other garnishment including a garnishment for the payment of taxes.

698.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
698.title: Temporary Disability Benefits And Contributions
698.description: Requires temporary disability contributions and benefits to be calculated based upon an employee's wages and salaries, that shall also include any sales commissions earned.

699.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
699.title: Regulation Of Personal Care Products
699.description: Requires the personal care product industry to more fully disclose the ingredients they use and, where applicable, identify ingredients that have been published as a chemical of concern on one or more designated list included in the act.

700.title: Responsible Recycling, Reuse And Disposal Of Mattresses
700.description: Requires copies of auditor's documents relative to evaluation and opinion about fees to be filed with the Rhode Island Resource Recovery Corporation and be considered public records pursuant to chapter 2 of title 38, access to public records.

701.title: Adult Use Of Cannabis Pilot Program
701.description: Establishes a system for the regulation and taxation for adult use and cultivation of marijuana.

702.title: Board Of Certification Of Operators Of Public Water Supply Facilities
702.description: Eliminates the cap on the maximum fee allowable for submitting an application for certification to the board of certifications of operators of public water supply facilities.

703.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
703.title: Local Tobacco Control Act
703.description: Creates a comprehensive resolution scheme for cities and towns to follow concerning the sale and control of tobacco in their communities.

710.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
710.title: Relating To Goddard State Park
710.description: Requires the department of environmental management to install certain moorings at Goddard State Park.

712.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
712.title: Relating To Agriculture And Forestry
712.description: Eliminates the need for city and town councils to appoint certain positions that are no longer necessary because of their antiquated duties.

713.title: Licensed Activities--currency Transmissions
713.description: Adds virtual currency to the existing electronic money transmission and sale of check licenses and adds additional regulatory provisions to simplify and clarify licensing related thereto.

715.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor (03/21/2019)
715.title: Field Trials And Shooting Preserves
715.description: Authorizes shooting preserves of five hundred (500) acres or greater to allow hunting deer, elk, or other animals in addition to domestic game birds as regulated by the department of environmental management.

717.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
717.title: Dry Dock Facilities
717.description: Amends the lien and notice procedures for facility operators of dry dock facilities.

718.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
718.title: The Rhode Island Early Childhood Innovation Act
718.description: Establishes the Rhode Island Early Childhood Innovation Act and funds to support programs designed to narrow the education achievement gap for at-risk children who are entering kindergarten.

720.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
720.title: Central Falls Retirees' Pension Benefits
720.description: Provides that effective September 1, 2019, Central Falls retirees or surviving spouses would receive seventy-six percent (76%) of their base pension benefits after adjustments, retroactive to January 1, 2019.

721.title: Relief Of Injured And Deceased Firefighters And Police Officers
721.description: Workers' compensation court to hear public safety injured-on-duty disability retirement matters and appeals.

722.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
722.title: Temporary Disability Insurance - Contributions
722.description: Permits employees who are covered by employer sponsored disability insurance programs to elect to be exempt from the state temporary disability insurance program, provided the employer has submitted documentation to the director confirming such coverage.

723.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
723.title: Housing Resources
723.description: Requires the general assembly to appropriate not less than $5,000,000 annually in capital financing for affordable housing development.

724.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
724.title: Motor Vehicle And Trailer Excise Tax Elimination Act Of 1998
724.description: Requires any reimposition of car/trailer excise tax subsequent to fiscal year 2024 phase-out shall provide a uniform statewide tax rate for use by cities and towns.

726.title: Relating To Public Officers And Employees
726.description: Provides state employee public safety professionals from the state retirement system on a position of parity with public safety employees of the municipal retirement system, effective July 1, 2019.

727.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
727.title: Rhode Island Promise Scholarship
727.description: Extends the Promise Scholarship program for two (2) years through 2022.

728.title: Licensing
728.description: Creates a new process with standards to be utilized when deciding whether an applicant's past criminal contacts' convictions should disqualify them from receiving a government issued license.

730.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
730.title: Balloons
730.description: Prohibits the release of balloons inflated with lighter-than-air gas.

732.title: Personal Care Attendant Program
732.description: Requires annual reports to track the number of caregiver assessments given as part of the assessments conducted for Medicaid long-term services and supports the creation of a family caregiver support association by the division of elderly affairs.

734.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
734.title: Economic And Climate Resilience Act Of 2019
734.description: Establishes a fee on companies that sell fossil fuels in Rhode Island for consumption or distribution within the state and establishes an "economic and climate resilience fund" to disburse the collected funds.

736.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
736.title: State Purchases
736.description: Authorizes CCRI, RIC, URI to sell obsolete/discarded/surplus technology to students at a discounted price with monies collected used to purchase updated electronic equipment/technology.

737.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
737.title: Hemp Growth Act
737.description: Repeals the licensure fee for a hemp license and reduce the license application fee from two hundred fifty dollars ($250) to one hundred dollars ($100).

738.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
738.title: Prompt Payment By Department Of Administration--subcontractor Payments
738.description: Helps expedite the payments made to subcontractors for work they perform on state contracts. It would also establish a new process to help minority business enterprises collect for their work on state contracts from their prime contractors.

739.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
739.title: School Committees And Superintendents - Beginning Of School Year
739.description: Requires public schools, including charter schools, to begin the school year on the day after Labor Day commencing in the school year 2020-2021.

745.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
745.title: Gambling And Lotteries
745.description: Allows social gaming in private residences and in public taverns or private clubs so long as the gambling is incidental to a bona fide social relationship between the participants and only participants receive anything of value.

746.title: Rhode Island Certifications Standards Board [see Title 16 Chapter 97 - The Rhode Island Board Of Education Act]
746.description: Creates the Right to Read Act to require certain licensed teachers to be proficient in scientific reading instruction.

747.title: Motor Vehicles - Definitions And General Code Provisions
747.description: Allows that the year of manufacture plate need only be attached to the rear of the vehicle.

749.title: Relating To Holidays And Days Of Special Observance
749.description: Expands definition of "employee" to include a caterer licensed by the department of health and division of taxation and food truck.

750.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
750.title: Relating Criminal Procedure-search Warrants -- Electronic Data Privacy Act
750.description: Establishes electronic data privacy act prohibiting any government entity from accessing electronic devices without search warrant. Consent, judicially recognized warrant exceptions, good faith and other exceptions would apply to the warrant requirement.

751.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
751.title: Search Warrants--electronic Data Disclosure Privacy Act
751.description: Requires that governmental entities seeking the disclosure of electronic communications from an electronic communication service obtain a warrant or court approved subpoena before doing so. Consent, voluntary disclosure and other exceptions would apply.

752.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
752.title: Rhode Island Public Transit Authority
752.description: Increases the number of members of the transit authority from eight to nine and makes the mayor of Providence or designee an ex officio member with voting privileges.

753.title: Property Subject To Taxation - Veterans' Exemptions
753.description: Grants the town council of the town of Jamestown the authority to provide for certain exemptions or tax credits for any veteran of the United States armed services.

755.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
755.title: Insurance Consumer Protection Sales Act
755.description: Prohibits person/business entity from conditioning requiring offer for sale/lease of tangible personal property on purchase of ins. From any ins. producer/insurer or releasing consumer's personal identification info eff. 1/1/20.

756.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
756.title: Housing Maintenance And Occupancy Code
756.description: Places responsibility on landlords to house evicted tenants due to landlord neglect/gives cities/towns revolving fund account flexibility/allows municipal lien similar to property taxes for action against property.

757.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
757.title: Relating To Education
757.description: Mandates that the state seal of biliteracy be awarded by the commissioner beginning with the class of 2020 and a report be given to the general assembly no later than 8/1/20 of students who have been awarded a state seal of biliteracy.

758.title: Licensing Of Health Care Facilities -- Sepsis Screening Protocols
758.description: Requires licensed health care facility medical staff to adopt, implement, periodically and update evidence-based protocols for the early recognition and treatment of patients with sepsis, severe sepsis and septic shock.

760.title: Supported Decision-making Act
760.description: Establishes the supported decision-making act which is a less restrictive alternative to guardianship for utilization of the probate courts.

762.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
762.title: Temporary Disability Insurance
762.description: Increases tax wage base for contributions to TDI /TCI, expands eligibility, increases benefit rates, adds sibling and grandchild in coverage benefits, increases temp caregiver weeks, and institutes fines for not reinstating an employee who uses program.

765.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
765.title: Therapeutic Riding
765.description: Provides for Medicaid reimbursement for therapeutic riding services.

766.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
766.title: Health Insurance Coverage--market Stability And Consumer Protection Act
766.description: Establishes the Rhode Island health insurance market stability and consumer protection act in order to update state law to reflect current insurance standards, practice and regulation to maintain market stability.

767.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
767.title: Wage Fairness Act
767.description: The wage fairness act prohibits employers from asking job applicants about salary history. It also prohibits discrimination in payment of wages, and allows employees to discuss their salary with co-employees.

768.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
768.title: Establishing The "commuter Transportation Benefits Act"
768.description: Establishes the commuter transportation benefit act.

769.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
769.title: Council On Postsecondary Education [see Title 16 Chapter 97 - The Rhode Island Board Of Education Act]
