769.description: Creates the "Rhode Island Student Success Act" which would identify those students who are exempt from paying nonresident tuition at public universities, colleges or community colleges.

770.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
770.title: License Procedure For Social Workers
770.description: Defines the educational requirements necessary to qualify an individual as a social worker, and further exempts social workers from the license procedures for licensed clinical social workers and licensed independent clinical social workers.

771.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
771.title: Communication Access
771.description: Provides medical insurance policies to provide coverage for communication access services for the hard-of-hearing.

772.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
772.title: Quality Self-directed Services
772.description: Establishes minimum qualifications for providers of covered home- and community-based services and direct support services and grants certain rights, and a complaint process to participants who receive direct-support services.

773.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
773.title: The State False Claim Act
773.description: Makes a change to the meaning of the words "knowing and "knowingly" in the state false claim act.

774.last_action: House voted to recommit to House Judiciary
774.title: Secretary Of State
774.description: Provides that lists of registered voters be made available to the general public by the secretary of state, and would repeal the requirement that the request be made under oath.

775.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor (04/02/2019)
775.title: Consumer Privacy Protection

776.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Vector Cuspis Oceanus, Llc
776.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Vector Cuspis Oceanus, Llc

777.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
777.title: 911 Emergency Telephone Number Act - Prepaid Wireless E911 Charge Act
777.description: Creates a restricted receipt account for all 911 funds and requires that they be used solely for the operation of the 911 system. Authorizes the PUC to reduce 911 surcharges to the extent they exceed the sums needed to operate the 911 system.

778.title: Registration Of Vehicles -- Registration Fees
778.description: Amends the date that a new, fully reflective registration plate would be issued from January 1, 2020 to December 1, 2019. The act would also increase the registration fee for fully reflective plates from $6.00 to fifteen dollars $15.00.

779.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
779.title: Insurance Coverage For Mental Illness And Substance Abuse
779.description: Requires insurance coverage for at least ninety (90) days of residential or inpatient services for mental health and/or substance-use disorders for American Society of Addiction Medicine levels of care 3.1 and 3.3.

780.title: Student Loan Bill Of Rights Act
780.description: Creates the "student loan bill of rights act" which establishes guidelines for the issuance of postsecondary loans.

781.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
781.title: Office Of Health And Human Services
781.description: Requires state contracted human services providers to pay his or her employees a minimum hourly wage no less than one hundred forty-four percent (144%) of the state minimum wage.

782.title: Biometric Information Privacy Protection Act
782.description: Prohibits collection of biometric identifiers without consent.

783.title: Authorizing The Town Of North Kingstown To Finance Construction, Renovations, Demolition, Remediation, Alterations, Additions And Other Improvements And/or Related Equipment For The Town Hall At 80 Boston Neck Road And At Memorial Park
783.description: PLAT 90 LOT 23) AND TO ISSUE NOT MORE THAN $7,500,000 BONDS AND NOTES THEREFOR (Authorizes the town of North Kingstown to issue not more than seven million five hundred dollars ($7,500,000) in bonds and notes to finance improvements and/or related equipment for the town hall.

786.title: Rhode Island Business Corporation Act
786.description: Imposes a fee of one hundred sixty dollars ($160) for all domestic and foreign corporations for a certificate of authority to transact business in this state.

787.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
787.title: Hotel Tax Distribution
787.description: The hotel tax shall be distributed as follows 1) 25% to host city/town; 2) 45% to appropriate regional tourism district; 3) 5% to Greater Providence-Warwick Convention and Visitors' Bureau; and 4) 25% to Rhode Island commerce corporation.

790.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
790.title: Wages
790.description: Increases min. Wage From $9 to $15 per hour by 1/1/24 and tipped min. Wage From $3.89 to $15 per hour by 1/1/28/Further increases depend on increases in CPI/Non-payment damage awards increased from 2 to 3 times unpaid amount/SOL increased from 3 to 6 yrs.

791.title: Relating To Consolidation Of The Albion And Saylesville Fire Districts Into The New Lincoln Fire District
791.description: Effectuates the consolidation of the Albion and Saylesville Fire Districts into a newly created Lincoln Fire District.

792.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
792.title: Municipal Detention Facility Corporations
792.description: Strips tax exempt status of municipal detention facility corporation; provides corporation ceases 90 days after dissolution vote and city/town council resolution; requires annual municipal approval of lease.

793.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
793.title: Tourism And Development
793.description: Revises the distribution of the hotel tax collected from residential units offered for tourist/transient use through hosting platforms.

795.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
795.title: Retirement System -- Contributions And Benefits
795.description: Changes the retirement benefits of state employees who were eligible to retire by reason of age on 6/30/12. Exempts these employees from the 401(a) plan, and returns them to the traditional defined benefit plan.

796.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
796.title: Retirement System
796.description: Requires payment of cost-of-living adjustments to capitol police officers who took early retirement in exchange for them. Provides any reduction of pension benefits due to overpayment of benefits be done over an extended period of amortization.

797.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
797.title: Motor Vehicle Excise Tax Phase Act
797.description: Requires the state to make each of its quarterly motor vehicle excise tax phase out reimbursements to the town of Cumberland, three (3) months earlier than the rest of the municipalities.

798.title: Relating To Local Real Estate Infrastructure Tax For The City Of Newport
798.description: Authorizes the city council of the city of Newport to levy an additional tax upon real property transfers within the city, not to exceed the amount of two percent (2%) of the purchase price.

801.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
801.title: Registration Of Vehicles--emergency Management Director Emeritus
801.description: Creates an emergency management director emeritus license plate for Thomas F. Senerchia of West Warwick.

803.title: Validating And Ratifying Amendments To The Home Rule Charter Of The Town Of North Kingstown
803.description: Ratifies amendments to the Home Rule charter of the town of North Kingstown adopted and approved by the electors of the town of North Kingstown on November 6, 2018.

804.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
804.title: Arrest
804.description: Adds Rhode Island certified state constables to the definition of peace officer.

805.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
805.title: Procedure Generally - Writs, Summons And Process
805.description: Provides for minimum qualifications for court constable to include education, military, or law enforcement experience and drug and psychological screening.

806.title: Relating To Elections
806.description: Permits, in certain circumstances, the publication, or broadcast of the likeness of an elected official on an official government website with 120 days preceding an election.

807.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
807.title: Computer Crime
807.description: Criminalizes accessing the user account of another person without consent for the purpose of viewing or using information maintained on any electronic database, website or account with each instance constituting a separate offense.

808.title: Permanent Joint Committee On Naming All New Buildings, Bridges, Edifices And Other State Constructions
808.description: Names the intersection of Hartford Avenue and Reservoir Avenue in the town of Johnston as "The Bernard 'Bernie' Frezza, Jr. Junction."

809.description: Allows a contractor or builder to hire a qualified third-party inspector or state inspector to perform an inspection if a building official fails to perform an inspection within forty-eight (48) hours after notification, excluding weekends/holidays.

810.title: Certified Nurse-teacher
810.description: Requires that only certified nurses-teachers may be employed as school nurses in elementary and secondary schools.

811.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
811.title: The Geoengineering Act
811.description: Establishes procedure/process to prohibit intentional environment manipulation by geoengineering and requires license from DEM to conduct any such activities.

813.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
813.title: Central Falls Retirees' Beneficiaries
813.description: Provides that a Central Falls retiree's beneficiary receive sixty-seven percent (67%) of the retiree's base pension benefit.

815.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
815.title: Judgments, Orders, And Decrees
815.description: Provides interest on civil actions be calculated at a rate equal to weekly average one year constant maturity Treasury yield, as published by Board of Governors of Federal Reserve System, for the calendar week preceding the date of the judgment.

821.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
821.title: Police Officers - Commission On Standards And Training
821.description: Requires training for police officers and trainees to more accurately identify complaints involving persons with cognitive or communication-related disabilities.

822.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Gym Kids Inc.
822.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Gym Kids Inc.

823.title: Amending The Charter Of North Providence
823.description: Requires that the purchasing board meeting agenda in the town of North Providence be sent to board members at least five (5) days before the meeting.

824.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
824.title: Size, Weight And Load Limits--smithfield And Lincoln
824.description: Prohibits commercial motor trucks, with a gross weight rating of twenty-six thousand one pounds (26,001 lbs.) or more, from traveling on Limerock Road, in Smithfield and Lincoln.

825.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

825.description: Amends procedures for annual/special Meetings/election/recall Of Officers/board Of Directors/duties Of Board/officers/tax Assessor/clerks/finance director-treasurer/tax collector/borrowing of funds/lighting installation/repair within 60 days of passage.

826.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
826.title: Dog Enforcement And Penalties -- Foster
826.description: Authorizes the Foster town council to enact ordinances permitting the dog officer in the town to issue citations for the violation of dog ordinances.

827.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
827.title: Impoundment And Disposition Of Uncollared Dogs -- Foster
827.description: Authorizes the Foster town council to enact an impoundment fee for impounded dogs.

830.title: Rhode Island Noncompetition Agreement Act
830.description: Creates a comprehensive statutory scheme to address all aspects of noncompetition agreements.

833.title: Related To Businesses And Professions - Rhode Island Health Information Exchange Act Of 2008
833.description: Provides for opt-out of information disclosure by HIE of confidential health care information.

834.title: Medical Assistance - Long Term Care Service And Finance Reform
834.description: Provides for a Medicaid home care, home nursing care and hospice base rate adjustment for services delivered to beneficiaries in rural communities as defined by the department of health.

835.title: Licensing Of Massage Therapists
835.description: Makes sweeping changes to the law on massage therapy licensing.

836.title: Amendment Of Corporate Charter
836.description: Repeals the existing provisions of the Corporate Charter and replaces them in their entirety.

839.last_action: Introduced, referred to House Small Business
839.title: Social Benefit Business Program
839.description: Establishes the Social Benefit Business Program.

840.title: Cruelty To Public Safety Dogs And Horses
840.description: Provides special protection to public safety canines and horses that are intentionally or maliciously subjected to cruelty, injuries, or death, by increasing the potential criminal and civil penalties for the offenders.

841.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
841.title: Political Advertising
841.description: Removes the exemption that allows elected officials to appear on a Rhode Island PBS Foundation television station program one hundred and twenty (120) days before any election in which they are a candidate.

842.last_action: Introduced, referred to House Veterans Affairs
842.title: Relating To The 9/11 Memorial
842.description: Amends the language on the 9/11 Memorial in the State House to include all Rhode Islanders.

846.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
846.title: Public Records Administration
846.description: Establishes public records program managed by administrator/state archivist for custody/disposal of state records assisted by 17 member advisory commission with civil penalties for violations.

847.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
847.title: Motor Vehicle Repair Shop Act
847.description: Allows a motor vehicle repair shop owner to sell, at a commercially recordable sale, a customer's vehicle if they fail to pay over thirty (30) days of properly charged storage fees.

849.title: Restroom Access Act
849.description: Requires retail establishments with 3 persons or more on premises without public restrooms to allow customers to use employee restrooms for certain medical conditions upon presentation of documentary proof with violators fined $250. Effective 1/1/20

850.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
850.title: Pfas In Drinking And Surface Waters
850.description: Establishes process to set maximum contaminate levels of polyfluoroalkyl substances (PFAS).

852.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
852.title: The Rhode Island Marijuana Expungement Act Of 2019
852.description: Entitles that past criminal misdemeanors and felonies for possession of marijuana may be expunged.

853.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
853.title: The Edward O. Hawkins And Thomas C. Slater Medical Marijuana Act - The Rhode Island Cannabis Equity Act Of 2019
853.description: Directs the department of business regulation to undertake a social equity and race analysis to examine whether racial disparities exist in matters related to marijuana.

854.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
854.title: Video - Lottery Games, Table Games And Sports Wagering
854.description: Casino may extend credit of $100,000 to a player.

855.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
855.title: The Edward O. Hawkins And Thomas C. Slater Medical Marijuana Act--the Rhode Island Marijuana Social Equity Program
855.description: Creates the Rhode Island Marijuana Social Equity Program to provide opportunities to people, who reside in areas determined to be disproportionately harmed by marijuana prohibition and enforcement, in gaining access to the marijuana industry.

857.title: The Rhode Island Municipal Infrastructure Grant Program
857.description: Removes the prohibition on state appropriations to the municipal infrastructure grant program, and authorizes the state planning council to evaluate, approve and issue such grants, subject to the appropriations provided to the program.

860.title: Insurance Benefits
860.description: Entitles correctional officers who have a minimum of twenty-five (25) years of service and who are at least fifty-five (55) years of age to receive a non-Medicare-eligible retiree health care insurance benefit.

862.title: Validating And Ratifying Amendments To The Home Rule Charter Of The Town Of Coventry
862.description: Validates and ratifies amendments to the home rule charter of the town of Coventry, which amendments were adopted and approved by the electors of the town of Coventry on November 6, 2018.

863.title: Education Accountability Act
863.description: Provides for greater school-based management at the school level and expands the duties of school improvement teams and establishes a new chapter on education accountability.

864.title: Certification Of Teachers
864.description: Allows teachers to obtain fast-track certification as a principal.

866.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
866.title: Healthy Workplace
866.description: Creates the "Healthy Workplace Act of 2019" and would establish a cause of action against employers and employees for workplace bullying, harassment and other abusive conduct.

867.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
867.title: Division Of Personnel Administration
867.description: Makes numerous changes to the merit system.

868.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
868.title: Courts -- Inactive Records
868.description: Provides requirements for attorney client's records and file retention.

869.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
869.title: Superior Court
869.description: Changes the name of the drug court magistrate to the "Rhode Island Superior Court adult drug/recovery court magistrate and changes the name of the court to the "Rhode Island Superior Court adult drug/recovery court".

870.title: Senior Savings Protection Act
870.description: Protects seniors and qualified disabled adults from financial exploitation.

871.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
871.title: Bus Lane Travel Fine
871.description: Creates a new traffic offense, with a fine, for traveling in a bus lane.

877.title: Unfair Claims Settlement Practices Act
877.description: Amends and expands the definitions of unfair claims practices committed by insurers with regard to physical inspection, performance of appraisals, retail valuation and total loss notification to owner.

878.title: Procedure Generally -- Causes Of Action
878.description: An insurer found in violation of the unfair claims settlement practices act can be liable for three (3) times the amount of damages.

879.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
879.title: Parole
879.description: This act would, upon its own motion or upon request of a parolee, enable the parole board to terminate a parolee's supervision and legal custody order. Prisoners with a life sentence for first and second degree murder are excluded.

880.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
880.title: Motor Vehicle Replacement Parts
880.description: Requires that the owner of a vehicle be notified in writing that installation of an aftermarket glass will require re-calibration of safety related systems, for which cost the insurer is responsible.

881.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
881.title: Prisoner Made Goods
881.description: Establishes prisoner made goods program that permits director of corrections to contract companies that ship goods out of United States for production and allows inmates to be paid the federal minimum wage to produce in Rhode Island.

883.title: Adult Education
883.description: Establishes office of adult education literarcy/employment advisory committee within GWBRI for adult education and literacy services/repeals adult education act and aid for evening schools eff. 12/1/19.

888.title: Limited Guardianship And Guardianship Of Adults
888.description: Requires that all persons seeking appointment as a limited guardian or guardian pursuant to chapter 15 of title 33 ("Limited Guardianships and Guardianship of Adults") be required to undergo a criminal background check.

889.title: Relating To Statutes And Statutory Construction
889.description: This act makes a number of technical amendments to the general laws, prepared at the recommendation of the Law Revision Office. Article I contains the reenactment of title 5 of the general laws. Article II includes the statutory construction provisions.

892.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
892.title: Tourism And Development -- Third Party Hosting Platform Municipal Registration Act
892.description: Prohibits a third party hosting platform from renting a short-term rental unit unless the unit is registered with the city/town. Allows the city/town to issue orders of compliance or impose fines for unregistered units.

893.title: Relating To To Incorporate Children's Grove
893.description: Allows private corporation, Children’s Grove, to convey its open space and recreational property to nonprofit third parties or a municipal corporation; provided that, such property shall be held and maintained for public recreation and open space.

894.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Santoro Industrial Supplies, Inc.
894.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Santoro Industrial Supplies, Inc.

898.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
898.title: Disposable Food Service Containers
898.description: Prohibits a covered establishment from preparing, selling, processing or providing food or beverages in or on a disposable food service container that is composed in whole or in part of polystyrene foam.

900.title: Retirement Of Municipal Employees And Closed Municipal Retirement Plans
900.description: Streamlines process for municipal retirement plans to join MERS by providing flexible funding policies/enables investment commission/general treasurer to invest closed plan assets for maximum efficiency/safety/liquidity.

901.title: Workers' Compensation
901.description: Provides employer pays any excess damages for an injured minor/clarifies liability of employer for violation of continuation of health care benefits for injured employee caused by employer/repeals obsolete/inapplicable workers' compensation laws.

902.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
902.title: Distributed Generation Interconnection
902.description: Requires elec. distribution co. to provide actual interconnection cost to customers within 90 days of modification/modifies application process with technical amendments approved by PUC not applicable to completed applications. eff. 30 days after passage.

903.title: Historic Residence--tax Credit
903.description: Amend the definition of commission under the Rhode Island historical preservation and heritage commission to include for purposes of historic structure property tax reduction in the town of Narragansett.

904.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
904.title: Historic Preservation Tax Credits
904.description: Extends historic tax credits for 3 years until December 31, 2022, projects which have been funded through the Cultural Arts and the Economy Grant program, as enacted in chapter 145 of the 2014 Pub. L., and which would have expired on December 31, 2019.

905.description: Modifies Warwick Sewer Authority Act by expanding number of members; increasing number of votes for by-law changes; providing for as many as thirty year installment payments; relieves owners with functioning septic systems from assessments for 20 years.

906.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
906.title: Rhode Island T.f. Green International Airport
906.description: Renames the state airport in Warwick from "T.F. Green state airport" to "Rhode Island T.F. Green International Airport."

908.description: Establishes an executive office of environmental management and the position of secretary of environment and provides for the establishment of an ocean management plan.

909.title: Rhode Island Livable Home Modification Act
909.description: Establishes the Rhode Island Livable Home Modification Grant which allows eligible homeowners and renters to retrofit their residence to nationally recognized accessibility standards.

910.title: Redevelopment Agencies And Projects
910.description: Authorizes state and local incremental tax revenues generated in the arts district, the growth center district and the ballpark district in the city of Pawtucket to be allocated to finance improvements in the districts.

911.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
911.title: Electricians
911.description: Permits a Certificate C license to be issued to the University of Rhode Island to perform certain electrical maintenance and repair as long as the university regularly employs one or more Class B or Class M journeyperson electricians.

912.title: Mechanical Trades
912.description: Provides for a limited license to be issued to HVAC service personnel to work on electrical wiring, equipment and components when servicing HVAC systems.

916.title: Authorizing An Increase In The Holdings Of Memorial And Library Association Of Westerly
916.description: Authorizes the Memorial and Library Association of Westerly to take, hold, transmit and convey real and personal estate to an amount not exceeding sixty-five million dollars ($65,000,000).

917.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor
917.title: Authorizing The Town Of Westerly To Issue Not To Exceed $71,000,000 General Obligation Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness To Finance The Construction, Renovation, Improvement, Alteration, Repair, Furnishing And Equipping Of Schools And School Facilities Throughout The Town, Subject To Approval Of State Housing Aid At A Reimbursement Rate Or State Share Ratio Of Not Less Than 35% For Expenditures Eligible For State Aid And Provided That The Authorization Shall Be Reduced By Any Grant Received From The School Building Authority Capital Fund
917.description: Authorizes Westerly to issue bonds and notes not to exceed 71 million for school improvements.

919.title: Emergency Medical Transportation Services
919.description: Amends the membership of the ambulance service coordinating advisory board.

922.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
922.title: Inspections
922.description: Authorizes the Exeter town sergeant or designees to conduct division of motor vehicles vehicle identifying number and odometer inspections.

923.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
923.title: Relating To The Governance Of The University Of Rhode Island
923.description: Establishes board of trustees for URI; establishes transfer of URI research foundation authority to board of governors if foundation dissolved; removes authority of council on postsecondary education over URI, requires disclosure of tuition waivers.

924.title: Levy And Assessment Of Local Taxes -- Johnston
924.description: Amends the property tax classification for the town of Johnston to be consistent with state law.

927.title: Life Insurance Policies And Reserves
927.description: Prohibits insurer from denying application/exclude/limit coverage under any life insurance policy based solely on prescription to carry or possess naloxone.

928.title: Authorizing The Town Of Westerly To Issue Not To Exceed $71,410,000 General Obligation Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness To Finance The Construction, Renovation, Improvement, Alteration, Repair, Furnishing And Equipping Of Schools And School Facilities Throughout The Town, Subject To Approval Of State Housing Aid At A Reimbursement Rate Or State Share Ratio Of Not Less Than 35% For Expenditures Eligible For State Aid And Provided That The Authorization Shall Be Reduced By Any Grant Received From The School Building Authority Capital Fund
928.description: Authorizes the town of Westerly to issue general obligation bonds, notes and other evidences of indebtedness not to exceed $71,410,000 for school improvements.

929.title: Miscellaneous
929.description: Provides no person may use wireless handset/personal wireless device for texting while driving.

930.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
930.title: Opioid Stewardship Act
930.description: Establishes an opioid stewardship payment program which manufacturers and distributors of opioids would pay into, to support opioid treatment programs.

932.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
932.title: Relating Towns And Cities -- Low- And Moderate-income Housing
932.description: Exempts certain residential units on lots in the Preserve at Boulder Hills in Richmond from being considered as year-round housing units when calculating the number of low- and moderate-income housing units.

933.last_action: Referred to Senate Housing and Municipal Government
933.title: City Housing Authorities
933.description: Adds two (2) additional members to the Woonsocket housing authority to be appointed by the mayor.

934.title: Rebuild Rhode Island Tax Credit
934.description: Establishes a Pawtucket-Central Falls station redevelopment district and provides that tax credits may be available for certain projects located in the district for an amount not to exceed 50% of the project cost.

939.title: Validating And Ratifying An Amendment To The Home Rule Charter Of The Town Of Tiverton
939.description: Validates and ratifies amendments to the Home Rule Charter of the town of Tiverton, which amendments were adopted and approved by the electors of the town of Tiverton on November 6, 2018.

941.title: Traumatic Brain Injuries
941.description: Adds six members to the commission on traumatic brain injuries.

942.title: Relating To Public Utilities And Carriers
942.description: Adds the house and senate minority leaders, or their designees, to the E-911 advisory commission.

946.title: State Building Code
946.description: Authorizes building inspectors to affix their signatures to permits that pertain to work they inspect.

947.title: Condominium Law - Management Of Condominium
947.description: Provides that financial and other records be made available for examination by unit owners within thirty (30) days of a request being made.

948.title: Proximity To Schools And Churches
948.description: Exempts the property located at 375 Smith Street, Providence, from the provisions prohibiting liquor licenses within a proximity of two hundred feet (200') of a school or church.

949.title: Assent To Food Safety Modernization Act
949.description: Assents to the FDA Food Safety Modernization Act, and empowers the director of DEM to perform those acts necessary, to be in compliance with the provisions of the act for the modernization of the safety of the food supply.

952.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
952.title: Abuse And Exploitation Of Elders--abuse And Isolation Of Elders Or Dependent Adults -- The Peter Falk Criminal Isolation Of Elders Act
952.description: Makes it a felony to isolate an elder or dependent adult and would expand the persons entitled to notice when a guardianship or conservatorship petition is filed in the probate court for dependents or elderly adults.

955.title: Rhode Island Food, Drugs, And Cosmetics Act
955.description: Limits the total amount that an insured person is required to pay for a covered prescription insulin drug at an amount not to exceed one hundred dollars ($100) per thirty (30) day supply.

956.last_action: Introduced, referred to House Municipal Government
956.title: Providence Homestead Exemption
956.description: Authorizes the city of Providence to adopt by ordinance a homestead exemption for local taxation on owner-occupied residential real property.

957.title: Validating And Ratifying Amendment To Section 2-1 Of The Home Rule Charter Of The City Of East Providence
957.description: Ratifies and confirms the amendment to Section 2-1 of the Home Rule Charter of the city of East Providence establishing four (4) year terms for members of the city council.

961.title: Curriculum [see Title 16 Chapter 97 - The Rhode Island Board Of Education Act]
961.description: Exempts those students in grade twelve (12) who are enrolled full-time in a dual enrollment program where the courses are taken on a higher education institution campus from the requirement that they complete health and physical education courses.

962.title: Declarations Of Candidacy
962.description: Requires all candidates to file financial statements within 30 days after filing notice of organization.

963.title: Rhode Island Infrastructure Bank
963.description: Expands the definition of “approved project” to include resiliency related infrastructure projects, and further prohibits the award of financial assistance for a water pollution abatement project.

966.title: Validating And Ratifying Amendments To The Home Rule Charter Of The Town Of Cumberland
966.description: Validates and ratifies amendments to the Home Rule Charter of the town of Cumberland, which amendments were adopted and approved by the electors of the town of Cumberland on November 6, 2018.

967.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
967.title: Surety Bond Required For Tax Credits
967.description: Requires an owner or developer of a project valued at or above $5,000,000 or more to attest by sworn affidavit that the properties have no outstanding liens and to file a surety bond conditioned upon payment for labor and materials of the project.

968.title: Suspension Or Revocation Of Licenses - Violations
968.description: Allows a person to make satisfactory arrangements for the payment of motor vehicle fines or costs, and would permit a person to request an ability to pay hearing before a license is suspended for failure to pay such fines or costs.

969.title: Campaign Finance
969.description: Reduces the minimum reporting campaign contribution amount that needs to be reported to the board of elections from over $100 to $25.00 for purposes of Campaign Contributions and Expenditures Reporting and the Ballot Question Advocacy and Reporting Acts.

971.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Prp, Inc.
971.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Prp, Inc.

972.title: Enabling The State Lottery Division Of The Department Of Revenue To Contract With Igt Global Solutions Corporation
972.description: Enable the state lottery division of the department of revenue to enter into a contract extension with IGT Global Solutions Corporation.
