1271.title: The Rhode Island Board Of Education Act
1271.description: Requires that the board of elementary and secondary education adopt a competency-based/proficiency-based learning policy whereby students can earn credits through demonstration of competency.

1274.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1274.title: Jobs Development Act
1274.description: Sunsets/discontinues the Jobs Development Act rate reduction as of July 1, 2019.

1276.title: Council On Postsecondary Education
1276.description: Authorizes and direct the board of governors for higher education to assess a transportation fee of fifty dollars ($50.00) per semester to students attending a RI public institution of higher learning.

1277.title: Little Cigar Tax
1277.description: Requires little cigars tax be imposed in the same manner as cigarette tax with twenty-five percent (25%) of revenue applied to smoking cessation programs and that little cigars be sold in packs of twenty (20) or more.

1282.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1282.title: Developmental Disabilities Ombudsperson Act
1282.description: Creates ombudsperson program for developmental disabilities attached to department of administration with ombudsperson selected by committee named by governor to advocate on behalf of affected adults.

1286.title: Fees
1286.description: Raises the juror's fees for each day's attendance on the superior court from $15.00 per day to $25.00 per day commencing July 1, 2020, and increase to $35.00 per day commencing July 1, 2021 and thereafter.

1289.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Washington County Builders, Inc.
1289.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Washington County Builders, Inc.

1292.title: Internet Service Providers - Net Neutrality
1292.description: Requires Internet service providers to follow Internet service neutrality requirements.

1304.title: Sales And Use Taxes - Personal Income Tax
1304.description: Subtracts state tax refunds, paid to an individual in the previous year, from federal adjusted gross income, for purposes of the state income tax for tax years beginning January 1, 2020.

1309.title: Medical Assistance And Public Assistance Caseload Estimating Conferences
1309.description: Requires the participation and input of the EOHHS, DHS, DCYF and BHDDH in medical assistance and public assistance caseload estimating conferences and the generation of monthly data to the members of the caseload estimating conference.

1316.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1316.title: Health Care Insurers -- Coordination Of Benefits
1316.description: Authorizes the department of business regulation to determine the status of insurers for coordination of benefits purposes when there are two or more insurers.

1319.title: The Licensure, Inspections And Investigations Of Developmental Disabilities Facilities
1319.description: Requires the department of behavioral healthcare, developmental disabilities and hospitals to make or cause to be made annual unannounced inspections and investigations of community residences.

1322.title: Parking Facilities And Privileges
1322.description: Provides that a vehicle unlawfully parked in a properly marked "handicapped parking" space would be towed at the owner's expense.

1324.title: Sales And Use Taxes - Enforcement And Collection
1324.description: Enacts two 10 year statute of limitations on two separate tax functions.

1326.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1326.title: Inheritance From Child By Non-supporting Parent
1326.description: Authorizes the probate court to deny a parent of a child who dies intestate from inheriting a share of the decedent's estate if that parent did not contribute to the child's support.

1327.title: The Uniformed Controlled Substances Act
1327.description: Expands drug awareness programs to high schools, directs funding from certain civil fines and mandates establishment of criteria for funding.

1331.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1331.title: Contractor's Registration And Licensing Board
1331.description: Prohibits any contractual clause in a contract for home repairs which would limit the homeowner's ability to initiate legal proceedings against the contractor for breach of contract.

1333.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1333.title: Animal Care -- Uniform Commercial Code -- Leases
1333.description: Prohibits the use of a dog or cat as security for its purchase where the seller or lender can repossess the dog or cat for failure to make payments. It also provides exceptions for certain agricultural activities.

1343.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Special Legislation and Veterans Affairs
1343.title: Adult Entertainment Performance Tax
1343.description: Imposes a $2.00 tax for admission to adult entertainment businesses. Funds to attorney general to disburse for combating human trafficking.

1346.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1346.title: Rhode Island Limited Liability Company Act
1346.description: Creates a five (5) year period after the date of dissolution, termination, or revocation of limited liability companies or corporations to settle and close its affairs but not to continue its business.

1348.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1348.title: Career And Technical Education
1348.description: Provides that the department of education, in consultation with a workgroup composed of various stakeholders, would develop a funding formula for school districts sending students to career and technical programs outside the district.

1354.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1354.title: The Education Equity And Property Tax Relief
1354.description: Amends the provisions of the Education Equity and Property Tax Relief Act.

1356.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1356.title: Quasi-public Corporations Accountability And Transparency Act
1356.description: Mandates that quasi-public corporations limit the use of all funds and property to perform the function or service for which the quasi-public corporation was created.

1358.title: Start-up Rhode Island Tax Free Zone Program
1358.description: Establishes the "Start-Up Rhode Island Act," whereby selected businesses would not be required to pay state income, business, corporate taxes, local taxes or franchise fees for a period of up to ten (10) years.

1359.title: State Tax Officials
1359.description: Increases the rate of interest on delinquent state tax payments from 2% to 3% greater than the prime rate, and also reduces the cap and floor on such interest to no greater than 15% and 12% per annum, respectively.

1360.title: Relating To Taxation-sales And Use Taxes-liability And Computation
1360.description: Increases the amount of the exemption from sales tax for clothing including footwear from $250 to $1,000.

1368.title: Sales And Use Taxes--liabilities And Computation
1368.description: Exempts the trade-in values of motorcycles from sales tax.

1370.title: Sales And Use Taxes - Liability And Compensation
1370.description: Exempts the trade-in value of pickup trucks weighing fourteen thousand pounds (14,000 lbs.) or less from sales and use tax.

1371.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1371.title: Prescription Drug Sales -- Representative Disclosure Act
1371.description: Requires prescription drug manufacturers to file a detailed, updated list of each pharmaceutical sales representative and to pay an annual fee for each name listed with the department of business regulation.

1372.last_action: Committee recommended Substitute A be held for further study
1372.title: Prescription Drug Benefits--prescription Drug Marketing
1372.description: Regulates prescription drug marketing by manufacturers using strategies offering various discounts to disguise costs of high priced drugs versus lower costs alternatives and makes discounts available to individuals without health insurance. Eff. 1/1/20.

1376.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1376.title: Communication Access Services
1376.description: Requires health insurance to provide coverage for communication access between deaf patients and their physicians.

1378.title: Uniform Control Substances Act
1378.description: Provides for physician/patient discussion regarding addiction and alternate treatment prior to initial and third opioid prescription.

1379.title: Long-term Managed Care Arrangements
1379.description: Requires managed care organizations to consult with the executive office of health and human services to develop incentives for nursing facilities that demonstrate lower direct care staff turnover.

1380.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1380.title: Nonprofit Dental Service Corporations
1380.description: Requires nonprofit dental service plan providers to provide notice of any changes relating to coverage to all plan purchasers purchasing dental services for employees under a group or individual policy.

1385.title: Johnston Planning Board
1385.description: Authorizes the Johnston town council to add two (2) alternate members to its planning board.

1386.title: Property Tax Relief
1386.description: Amends the definition of "disabled", for the purposes of property tax relief, to include veterans who earn less than thirty thousand dollars ($30,000) annually and who receive disability benefits.

1389.title: Resale Of Units
1389.description: Imposes a penalty against a condominium association that fails to deliver a resale certificate within ten (10) days of a request by a unit owner.

1395.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1395.title: Mandatory Dog And Cat Microchipping Act
1395.description: Provides for the mandatory microchipping of all dogs and cats and applicable penalties to the owner for failing to microchip the animal.

1399.title: Relating To Motor And Other Vehicles-motor Vehicles Reparations Act
1399.description: Penalizes a motorist for two (2) separate violations if they are driving an unregistered motor vehicle and without insurance or proof of insurance.

1403.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1403.title: Procedure In Particular Actions - Small Claims And Consumer Claims
1403.description: Increases the maximum dollar amount from two thousand five hundred dollars ($2,500) to five thousand dollars ($5,000) for claims handled in small claims court.

1404.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1404.title: Wrongful Discharge From Employment
1404.description: Ends Rhode Island's "employment-at-will" legal doctrine, provides job protection for employees that satisfactorily perform their duties provides specific remedies for wrongful discharge.

1407.title: Equal Pay Data Collection And Reporting
1407.description: Requires employers with 100 employees to yearly submit a form to the department of labor and training, which contains information regarding the compensation and hours worked of employees by age, gender, race, ethnicity, job category and occupation title.

1412.title: Fees For State Colleges And Universities - Veterans
1412.description: Authorizes state higher education institutions to waive application and transcript fees for veterans.

1418.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1418.title: The Federal Shutdown Affected Employees Loan Program
1418.description: Establishes a new program which would assist federal employees who have been affected by a federal government shutdown by making available state-backed loans in an amount not to exceed five thousand dollars ($5,000).

1420.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1420.title: Interest And Usury
1420.description: Reduces the usury rate to twelve percent (12%).

1421.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1421.title: Public Safety Grant Administration Office
1421.description: Extends the sunset provision for the pilot program known as "after school alternative program" until June 30, 2024.

1428.title: Sales Tax
1428.description: Eliminates the sales tax on taxi services and pet care services.

1431.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1431.title: Levy And Local Assessment Of Local Taxes
1431.description: Applies a tax to moderate-income housing equal to eight percent (8%) of the property's previous years' gross scheduled rental income.

1433.title: Sales And Use Taxes--enforcement And Collection
1433.description: Exempts persons with a retail sales permit from requirement of paying a registration fee for making sales at a flea market.

1435.title: Mental Health Consumer Advocates Of Rhode Island -- Oasis Wellness And Recovery Center
1435.description: Establishes a mental health consumer advocate and wellness recovery center to provide support for those suffering from mental health issues and would appropriate two-hundred ninety five thousand dollars ($295,000) to operate the program.

1437.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Health and Human Services
1437.title: "the Rhode Island Informed Consent Protection Act"
1437.description: Provides for vaccine informed consent. Fines For Violations.

1439.title: The Healing Art Of Acupuncture And Oriental Medicine
1439.description: Allows individuals otherwise certified to practice acupuncture and Chinese medicine using Chinese medical diagnostic methods.

1440.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1440.title: Registration Of Nursing Assistants
1440.description: Allows for a nurse to delegate tasks to certified nursing assistants and authorizes the department of health to promulgate regulations that delineate delegable tasks.

1444.title: Pawtucket Opportunity Zone Income Tax Credit Act
1444.description: Tax credit for opportunity zone in investment in Pawtucket

1455.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1455.title: Immigration Status
1455.description: Prohibits a landlord from asking about the immigration status of a tenant, prospective tenant, occupant, or prospective occupant of residential rental property.

1456.title: State Affairs And Government - Residence Of Those In Government Custody Act
1456.description: Requires the state to use the actual residence of persons in government custody for redistricting purposes. Their actual residences would be collected by the dept.of corrections and forwarded to the secretary of state to be utilized for redistricting.

1460.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1460.title: Courts - Commission On Judicial Tenure And Discipline
1460.description: Amends several provisions relative to how the commission on judicial tenure and discipline provide discipline, hearings and discovery.

1461.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1461.title: Disorderly Conduct
1461.description: Amends the penalty provisions for disorderly conduct, willful trespass, and shoplifting.

1471.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1471.title: Rhode Island Business Corporations Act - Nonprofit Corporation Act - Limited-liability Company Act
1471.description: Removes the 10 year period within which time the secretary of state's office is authorized to withdraw a certificate of revocation for all Rhode Island business corporations, foreign corporations, nonprofit corporations and limited liability companies.

1486.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1486.title: Drinking Water Supply System Protection
1486.description: Reduces the number of water quality fund classes from three to two.

1491.title: Rhode Island Housing Resources Act Of 1998
1491.description: Requires $5,000,000 bond referendum for affordable housing with a $700 rental price ceiling per unit for the fiscal year 2021.

1501.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1501.title: State Aid To Libraries
1501.description: Increases the state's share to support local public library services in distressed communities, by an amount equal to the amount paid by the distressed city or town into the ocean state libraries (OSL) annual assessment charges.

1509.title: Family Caregivers Support Act Of 2013
1509.description: Requires annual reports to track the number of caregiver assessments given as part of the assessments conducted for Medicaid long term services and supports the creation of a family caregiver support association by the division of elderly affairs.

1513.title: Accident And Sickness Insurance
1513.description: Allows pregnant women with an annual family income above applicable Medicaid income limit to be eligible to purchase health insurance through one of the Medicaid managed care plans.

1517.title: Uniform Controlled Substances Act -- Non-opiate Directive
1517.description: Directs filing non-opiate directives with the DOA and deletes requirements for recording in electronic health record and verification by a registered practitioner. Replaces medical disciplinary board with the dept of health for compliance violations.

1524.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1524.title: Zoning Ordinances-neighborhood
1524.description: Amends several sections of the Rhode Island Zoning Enabling Act of 1991 with the intent of preserving neighborhood character and promoting smart growth.

1526.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1526.title: Kent County Water District
1526.description: Reduces the term of office members and chair of the Kent County Water District board from seven (7) years to three (3) years, effective September 1, 2019 and limits the chair to three (3) consecutive terms.)

1528.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1528.title: Conduct Of Election And Voting Equipment And Supplies
1528.description: Requires employers to give their employees, who make a timely request, two (2) hours of paid leave to vote. This act would be enforced by the department of labor and training.

1531.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1531.title: General Provisions -- Registration Of Voters
1531.description: Allows an individual who is eligible to vote and turns eighteen (18) years of age on or before the date of a general election to vote in the primary election immediately preceding that general election.

1532.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1532.title: Lila Manfield Sapinsley Compassionate Care Act
1532.description: Creates the Lila Manfield Sapinsley Compassionate Care Act, to provide a legal mechanism whereby a terminally ill patient may choose to end his or her life using drugs prescribed by a physician.

1542.title: Fair Employment Practices -- Sexual Harassment
1542.description: Extends protection to domestic servants/includes retaliation as unlawful practice and requires employers of 4 or more employees to conduct sexual harassment programs for new employees within 1 month of the date of hire/all employees by September 1, 2019.

1544.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1544.title: Snow Removal Service Liability Limitations Act
1544.description: Regulates snow removal contracts between service providers and service receivers, limit liability between them, and declare certain indemnity agreements void as against public policy.

1557.title: Noncompete Agreements - Broadcast Employees
1557.description: Prohibits the inclusion of noncompete agreements in broadcast industry employment contracts that are entered into after January 1, 2020.

1560.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1560.title: Pickled Fish
1560.description: Repeals several sections of the general laws regarding the pickling, packaging, sorting, and branding of pickled fish.

1562.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1562.title: Soda And Cream Of Tartar
1562.description: Repeals the requirement that city and town councils appoint an inspector or saleratus, bicarbonate of soda, and cream of tartar in order to test for adulterated product, and eliminates the fine for any person selling such adulterated product.

1563.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1563.title: False Personation
1563.description: Removes auctioneers, corders of wood and fence viewers as subjects of this violation and would set forth the penalty for impersonating the town sealer of weights and measures.

1564.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1564.title: Dueling And Fighting
1564.description: Repeals § 11-12-4 of the general laws that prohibits a person from being a second at a duel that results in the infliction of a mortal wound.

1566.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1566.title: Firewood And Charcoal
1566.description: Repeals the provision of the general laws that require baskets of charcoal be sealed by the sealer of weights and measures of the town where the person so using the basket resides, or of the town where the charcoal is measured for sale.

1567.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1567.title: Highway
1567.description: Repeals several criminal offenses pertaining to three (3) bridges, including the Crawford Street Bridge, the Apponaug River Bridge, and the Pawtuxet Falls Bridge.

1568.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1568.title: Animals At Large
1568.description: Repeals the section of the law authorizing the impoundment of at large animals in private ways in Newport.

1571.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1571.title: Theft, Embezzlement, False Pretenses And Misappropriation
1571.description: Repeals the statute imposing a fine not to exceed twenty dollars ($20.00) on a person robbing or drawing a fishpot, weir or net belonging to another person.

1572.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1572.title: Trespass And Vandalism
1572.description: Repeals the prohibition of the general laws regarding the removal of gravel or the deposit of debris from Easton's Beach, the enforcement provisions thereto, and the bounds of Easton's Beach.

1573.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1573.title: Public Utilities
1573.description: Repeals the requirement that phone books contain a "Warning" that refusal to relinquish, or damage a phone in certain circumstances may be a crime.

1575.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1575.title: Seaweed
1575.description: Repeals Chapter 46-11 which prohibits the taking of seaweed by anyone not a resident of the town of Barrington and imposes fines for doing so.

1581.title: Municipal Police Contracts
1581.description: Extends provisions of an existing collective bargaining agreement for municipal police arbitration purposes until a successor agreement is reached or an interest arbitration award is rendered.

1589.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1589.title: Joint Committee On Naming New Buildings
1589.description: Names the traffic tribunal building on New London Avenue "The Albert E. DeRobbio Traffic Tribunal."

1594.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Mp Cleaning Co. Inc.
1594.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Mp Cleaning Co. Inc.

1597.title: Transportation Network Company Services
1597.description: Exempt New Shoreham from the jurisdiction of the division of PUC for purposes of regulating transportation network companies, and allows the town to establish its own regulatory framework regarding transportation network company services.

1603.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1603.title: Relating To Education-curriculum
1603.description: Requires elementary schools to provide instruction in cursive penmanship.

1604.last_action: Referred to House Environment and Natural Resources
1604.title: Agricultural Functions Of Department Of Environmental Management
1604.description: Defines the term "farm products" for the purposes of enforcement and regulation of the agricultural functions of the department of environmental management.

1606.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1606.title: Milk Sanitation
1606.description: Exempts the producers of certain milk and milk product produced for personal consumption from the inspection requirements of the milk sanitation code.

1615.title: Marijuana Impact Study
1615.description: Creates and funds a study on the impact of the use of marijuana in this state.

1617.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1617.title: Teachers' Retirement
1617.description: Gradually increases the state's contribution to the teachers' retirement system, while reducing the municipal contribution, eventually resulting in the contributions being shared equally.

1618.title: Relating To Human Services-public Assistance
1618.description: Provides that for the purpose of determining income limitations for receiving general public assistance, child support that is in arrears for thirty (30) days or more would not be considered to be income.

1628.title: Tuition Equity
1628.description: Creates the "student equal economic opportunity act" which would allow students who meet certain requirements to be exempt from paying nonresident tuition at Rhode Island universities, colleges or community colleges.

1633.title: Veterans' Small Business Loan Program
1633.description: Creates a transitioning veterans' small business loan program through the commerce corporation.

1637.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1637.title: Insurance
1637.description: Establishes audit requirements for pharmacy benefit managers, and would also establish annual reporting requirements for health insurers.

1644.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1644.title: Food And Drugs - Regulation Of Personal Care Products
1644.description: Requires the personal care product industry to more fully disclose the ingredients they use and, where applicable, identify ingredients that have been published as a chemical of concern on one or more designated list included in the act.

1645.title: Licensure Of Interpreters For The Deaf
1645.description: Prohibits a person who is under the age of eighteen (18) to work or volunteer in the medical settings including mental health and behavioral health care facilities for any deaf and hard of hearing clients or patients.

1647.title: In Amendment To The Charter Of The Central Coventry Fire District Pursuant To A Resolution Of The Board Of Directors Of The Coventry Fire District On December 27, 2018
1647.description: Makes various amendments pertaining to the duties and operations of the Central Coventry Fire District.

1653.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1653.title: Procedure Generally - Nondisclosure Agreements
1653.description: Places limits on the terms that can be included in an agreement that settles a claim of sexual harassment, retaliation for reporting sexual harassment and stalking.

1655.title: General Regulatory Provisions - Service Contracts
1655.description: Defines service contracts and clarifies that consumer service contracts are not insurance and not otherwise subject to the insurance code.

1657.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1657.title: Fair Employment Practices Act
1657.description: Changes the definition of employee and employer for purposes of the fair employment practices act, while expanding personal liability for violations.

1684.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1684.title: Mail Ballots - Conduct Of Election And Voting Equipment And Supplies
1684.description: Require any person voting by mail ballot or emergency mail ballot to provide proof of identity, exempting those in a hospital, hospice, or skilled nursing facility.

1687.title: Full Enforcement Of Support Obligations
1687.description: Reduces the number of days of child support arrearage from 90 days to 60 days for an obligor to be deemed not in compliance with a court order of child support and be subject to license suspension.

1690.title: Procedure In Particular Actions - Contribution Among Joint Tortfeasors
1690.description: Provides that a release by one claimant relative to claims relating to the Feld Entertainment/Ringling Brothers Circus accident of 5/4/14 would not discharge other joint tortfeasors.

1702.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1702.title: Salaries And Traveling Expenses
1702.description: Requires all non-supervisory classified employees to electronically record their daily work hours.

1706.title: Payment Of Wages - Violations
1706.description: Increases penalties for violations of certain wage and hour laws.

1708.title: Arbitration -- Continuance Of Contractual Provisions
1708.description: Requires that the contractual provisions contained in an otherwise expired collective bargaining agreement with certified school teachers and municipal employees would continue until a successor agreement has been reached between the parties.

1709.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1709.title: Holiday And Sunday Work
1709.description: For purposes of overtime pay on Sundays and holidays, removes health care and maintenance workers from the definition of employees not entitled to overtime pay, thereby enabling them to collect overtime pay.

1711.title: Holley Landing
1711.description: Renames the landing in South Kingstown known as Wordens Pond Landing to Holley Landing.

1712.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1712.title: Lending Or Borrowing Money Or Receipt Of Credit By Licensees
1712.description: Prohibits the lending or borrowing of money or receipt of credit by delinquent licensees among manufacturers, wholesalers and retailers of alcoholic beverages as regulated by the department of business regulation (DBR).

1720.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1720.title: State Department Of Elementary And Secondary Education
1720.description: Authorizes the council on elementary and secondary education to waive certain provisions of the laws on elementary and secondary education for public schools but would prohibit the waiver of other listed provisions.

1726.title: Council On Elementary And Secondary Education [see Title 16 Chapter 97 - The Rhode Island Board Of Education]
1726.description: Provides that the commissioner of elementary and secondary education would be appointed by the governor with the advice and consent of the senate. The commissioner of elementary and secondary education would serve at the pleasure of the governor.

1728.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1728.title: Protecting Student Privacy On School-owned Technology
1728.description: Establishes certain student privacy rights in regard to take-home technology devices from school.

1729.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1729.title: Taxation Of Beverage Containers, Hard-to-dispose Material And Litter Control Participation Permittee
1729.description: Eliminates the tax imposed on hard-to-dispose materials such as lubricating oils, glycol-based antifreeze and tires used on motor vehicles.

1731.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1731.title: Establishing Appliance And Equipment Energy And Water Efficiency Standards Of 2019
1731.description: Establishes minimum energy and water efficiency standards for appliances and specified equipment purchased or installed after July 1, 2020.

1734.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1734.title: Retirement Security Act For Locally Administered Pension Funds
1734.description: Authorizes the general treasurer to withhold state aid to municipalities which do not meet certain requirements regarding locally-administered pension plans and, if applicable, funding improvement plans.

1736.title: Senior Center Building Capital Fund
1736.description: Creates senior center building capital fund to provide cities and towns with financial assistance up to thirty percent of the construction cost of the project.

1741.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1741.title: Stay Invested In Ri Wavemaker Fellowship
1741.description: Repeals the provisions of the Stay Invested in RI Wavemaker Fellowship, and establish the Stay Invested in RI Tax Credit to provide eligible taxpayers with a tax credit for educational loan repayment expenses.

1746.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1746.title: Sales And Use Taxes - Computation And Liability
1746.description: Exempts from the sales and use taxes tangible personal property donated for a charitable purpose to nonprofit organization deemed tax-exempt by both the federal government, this state or any state government of the United States of America.

1761.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1761.title: Non-emergency Medical Transportation
1761.description: Lists information needed by recipients of transportation of non-emergency medical appointment services.

1777.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1777.title: Nomination - Declaration Of Candidacy, And Primary Votes
1777.description: Sets an earlier deadline for the filing of declaration of candidacy and nomination papers while also moving the party primary from September to August.

1784.last_action: Committee recommended Substitute A be held for further study
1784.title: Real Estate Disclosures
1784.description: Adds to the disclosure form, that a seller must complete for prospective buyers, detailed information on the need and cost for flood insurance on the property to be sold.

1792.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1792.title: Labor And Payment Of Debts By Contractors
1792.description: Public works project subcontractors may seek payment directly from awarding authority.

1794.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1794.title: Electronic Voting
1794.description: Requires the joint committee on legislative services to make the record of the votes of the general assembly available to the public and the secretary of state electronically within thirty (30) minutes of the casting of said vote.

1804.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1804.title: Sidewalks
1804.description: Requires the director of the department of transportation to organize and complete snow removal from all sidewalks located on state highway overpasses and pedestrian overhead walkways within 24 hours of a snowstorm.

1815.title: Lumber Surveyors
1815.description: Repeals the provision that requires city and town councils appoint one or more surveyor and measurer of boards, plank, timber, joint and scantling.

1816.title: Shipwrecks
1816.description: Repeals the requirement that the town council of every town shall annually appoint a commissioner of wrecks and shipwrecked goods.

1819.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1819.title: Utility District Energy Costs
1819.description: Requires the state to pay the energy costs necessary to supply public street lighting if the local utility district fails to do so.

1821.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1821.title: Private Schools [see Title 16 Chapter 97--rhode Island Board Of Education Act]
1821.description: Requires a proposed private school to demonstrate financial stability.

1826.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1826.title: Nuisance Actions Against Seafood And Commercial Fishing Industry
1826.description: Precludes Rhode Island local fishermen or aquaculturists from being found a public or private nuisance due to alleged objectionable odor or noise as a result of generally accepted industry procedures.

1830.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1830.title: Public Safety Employees
1830.description: Adds department of corrections' correctional officers to the list of public safety employees that are entitled to their full salary if they are injured and become disabled as a result of performance of their job duties.

1831.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1831.title: Licensing Of Health-care Facilities
1831.description: Requires the tax administrator to remit eighteen percent (18%) of all hospital licensing fees to the city of Woonsocket collected from any hospital located in the city of Woonsocket.

1834.title: Rhode Island Opportunity Zone Tax Credit And Tax Exemption Act
1834.description: Provides a tax credit for qualified investments in "opportunity zones" as defined by federal law and located in Rhode Island.

1845.title: Ensuring Access To High Quality Care For The Treatment Of Substance Use Disorders
1845.description: Establishes the medication assisted treatment (MAT) program which uses medications, in combination with counseling and behavioral therapies, to create a comprehensive approach to the treatment of substance use disorders.

1846.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1846.title: Penalties
1846.description: Provides for the assessment of administrative monetary penalties for certain licensed professionals who are found guilty of unprofessional conduct.

1847.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1847.title: Psychology Interjurisdictional Compact
1847.description: Authorizes the governor to enter into the Psychology Interjurisdictional Compact and designates an office to administer this compact.

1848.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1848.title: Relating To Insurance Health Care Market Stability
1848.description: Establishes a reinsurance program in order to provide stability in the individual insurance market and imposes a shared responsibility payment penalty for individuals who do not have health insurance coverage with certain exceptions.

1851.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1851.title: Sidewalks Along State Highways
1851.description: Requires the department of transportation to clear sidewalks of snow and ice on state roads for school bus stops along routes approved by the respective school committees and chief of police for each city and town.

1859.title: Offenses Pertaining To Schools [see Title 16 Chapter 97 - The Rhode Island Board Of Education Act]
1859.description: Prohibits the use of a school district's listserv to distribute any political advertisement, invitation, and/or propaganda.

1868.title: Party Primary Date
1868.description: Changes the date of party primaries from the second Tuesday after the first Monday in September in each even numbered year to the first Tuesday in June in each even numbered year.

1874.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1874.title: Safety Responsibility Administration -- Security
1874.description: Makes sweeping changes to the motor vehicles laws by repealing the many sections that require the filing of security or bond with the DMV following a motor vehicle accident.

1875.title: Mortgage Foreclosure And Sale
1875.description: Provides that fifty dollars ($50.00) of the filing fee paid to the HUD-approved agency for the mediation conference involving the mortgagee and mortgagor, shall be paid to the Rhode Island Legal Services.

1878.title: Governor's Workforce Board Rhode Island
1878.description: Requires the workforce board to fund a non-trade apprenticeship incentive program in fisheries.

1881.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of W.d. Schock Co., Inc.
1881.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of W.d. Schock Co., Inc.

1889.title: Apprenticeships
1889.description: Comprehensively amends the state's apprenticeship laws to make them easier to understand and be more consistent with each other and applicable federal regulations.

1897.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Middletown Rotary Club, Inc.
1897.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Middletown Rotary Club, Inc.

1905.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1905.title: The Board Of Education Act
1905.description: Requires the board of education to develop and implement a 5 year plan to improve student performance in science, technology, engineering, arts, and math and increase the number of postsecondary degrees awarded in STEAM fields on or before 2/1/20.

1918.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Health and Human Services
1918.title: Treatment For Patients With Terminal Illness--the Neil Fachon Terminally Ill Patients' Right To Try Act Of 2019
1918.description: Creates the "Neil Fachon Terminally Ill Patients' Right To Try Act of 2019," which establishes the conditions for the use of experimental treatments for terminally ill patients.

1919.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1919.title: Central Service Technicians
1919.description: Provides licensing and regulation of central service technicians, i.e., persons who decontaminates, inspects, assembles, packages, and sterilizes reusable medical instruments or devices.

1920.title: Accident And Sickness Insurance Policies - Step Therapy Protocols
1920.description: Requires health insurers, nonprofit hospital service corporations, nonprofit medical service corporations and health maintenance organizations that issue policies that provide coverage for prescription drugs and use step therapy protocols.

1921.last_action: Senate passed Sub A as amended (floor amendment)
1921.title: Sepsis Protocols
1921.description: Requires hospitals to adopt, implement, periodically update and submit to the director of health, evidence-based protocols for the early recognition and treatment of patients with sepsis and septic shock.

1925.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1925.title: Elections -- Nomination Of Party And Independent Candidates; Rhode Island Campaign Contributions And Expenditures Reporting; Criminal Offenses -- Theft, Embezzlement, False Pretenses, And Misappropriations
1925.description: Amends certain campaign contribution and expenditure reporting requirements and would provide for forfeiture of campaign contributions upon a conviction or plea of nolo contendere to specified felony crimes relating to public office.

1936.title: Insurers' Rehabilitation And Liquidation Act -- Insurance Receivership Model Act
1936.description: Adopts a portion of the National Association of Insurance Commissioners (NAIC) model act with respect to receiverships, specifically with regards to how derivative contracts are treated in cases of insurance receiverships.

1939.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Adroit Software Inc.
1939.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Adroit Software Inc.

1943.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1943.title: Utility Service Restoration Act
1943.description: Requires electric/gas distribution companies submit to DPUC an emergency response plan on/before 6/1/20 and annually; authorizes civil/administrative penalties for noncompliance; establishes process for DPUC to assess same.

1950.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1950.title: Regional Vocational Schools [see Title 16 Chapter 97 -- The Rhode Island Board Of Education Act]
1950.description: Amends the career and technical education program laws to provide the process by which students could access career and technical education programs outside of their home school district.

1951.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1951.title: Public Drinking Water Supply System Protection
1951.description: Creates the water security act of 2019 to ensure equal access to safe drinking water for all citizens of the state.

1961.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1961.title: Traffic Tribunal
1961.description: Vests jurisdiction over the adjudication of violations relating to obstructing and interfering with the lawful taking of wildlife with the Rhode Island traffic tribunal, and would set forth the relevant penalties related thereto.

1963.title: Courts - Judicial Selection
1963.description: Requires all state departments cooperate with judicial nominating commission, provide any information that might assist in judicial selection. Requires DOA provide secure office space on state property. Requires written minutes of all commission meetings

1969.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of 61 Pilsudski St., Llc
1969.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of 61 Pilsudski St., Llc

1971.title: In Accordance With Rhode Island General Laws Section 16-7-44 Approving The Issuance Of $160,000,000 General Obligation Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness Of The City Of Providence To Fund The School Capital Improvements Plan For The Fiscal Years 2019-2024
1971.description: In Accordance With Rhode Island General Laws Section 16-7-44 Approving The Issuance Of $160,000,000 General Obligation Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness Of The City Of Providence To Fund The School Capital Improvements Plan For The Fiscal Years 2019-2024

1981.title: Certification Of Teachers - Testing Requirements For New Teachers
1981.description: Establishes testing requirements for initial certification of new teachers on or after July 1, 2021.

1983.title: Training And Evaluation - Evaluation Requirements
1983.description: Directs the council on elementary/secondary education to implement assessment/evaluation systems for teachers/administrators.

1990.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1990.title: Idling
1990.description: Removes the word diesel in regard to idling of engines and would pertain to idling of all engines.

2008.title: Employment Security--benefits
2008.description: Eliminates requirement to pay attorney fees from employment security (unemployment) administrative fund.

2011.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2011.title: General Provisions - Manufacturing And Wholesale Licenses
2011.description: Authorizes the issuance of farmer brewery and farmer distillery licenses to qualifying farms subject to conditions and regulations issued by the department of regulation.

2012.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2012.title: Burial Of Veterans
2012.description: Allows a veteran who qualifies to be buried at the Rhode Island veterans' memorial cemetery to designate a domestic partner to be buried with them.

2013.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2013.title: Relating To The State-operated Gaming Facilities In Tiverton
2013.description: Preserves and protects the state's ability to maximize revenues at the Tiverton Casino by authorizing an amendment to the Twin River-Tiverton marketing program.

2025.title: Continuous Improvement -- Annual Policy Review
2025.description: Requires the board of education to conduct a comprehensive study of the Massachusetts Education Reform Act and report yearly to the governor, the senate and the house of representatives.

2026.title: Curriculum And Access To Advanced Placement Courses
2026.description: Requires all high school students graduating in 2021 and thereafter attending public or any schools managed and controlled by the state to demonstrate proficiency in one course in computer science education.

2028.title: Model For Dual Language Immersion Programs
2028.description: Requires the department of education to create a model policy/timeline to assist school districts in implementing a dual language immersion program. This model policy and timeline would be sent to the president of the senate and the speaker of the house.

2030.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2030.title: Promotion
2030.description: Directs the department of elementary and secondary education to convene a group of stakeholders to review the standards for grade level promotion established by local education agencies.

2049.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2049.title: Board Of Regents For Elementary, Secondary Education
2049.description: Requires that the library-media program outlined in the Rhode Island Basic Education Plan (BEP) in section G-13-1.3.11 be staffed by a school librarian with certification from an American Library Association (ALA) accredited program.

2050.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor (06/26/2019)
2050.title: Newport Admission Fee Surcharge
2050.description: Authorizes the city of Newport to impose a surcharge on the price of admission to organizations or venues that sell more than twenty thousand (20,000) tickets during the time period commencing on July 1, 2018 until June 30, 2019.

2060.title: Exploitation Of Elders
2060.description: Changes the definition of "elder person" for purposes of exploitation of elders from a person sixty-five (65) years of age or older to a person sixty (60) years of age or older.
